Cc: Sullivan, Jacob J Madam Secretary, Attached please find brief backgrounder United States Institute Peace. Please let know would like information. Thanks, Mike United States Institute Peace: Background Proposals creation government "peace" agency stretch far back proposal 1792 create "Peace Office" par War Department. Between 1935 1976 140 bills introduced Congress establish peace-related agencies, departments, bureaus, committees Congress. In 1979 Congress established Commission Proposals National Academy Peace Conflict Resolution. In 1981, Commission — known Matsunaga Commission head, Senator Spark Matsunaga — recommended creation national peace academy. In 1984, President Reagan signed United States Institute Peace Act first meeting USIP's Board Directors took place 1986. The USIP Act established "an independent, nonprofit, national institute serve people Government widest possible range education trainings, basic applied research opportunities, peace information services means promote international peace resolution conflicts among nations peoples world without recourse violence." USIP independent agency, funded Congress, serves intersection involved policy research, fieldwork, practitioners. More 70 USIP policy experts conduct research wide variety country- specific cross-cutting functional issues. Some examples USIP activities include: ® Working countries Iraq, Sudan, Nigeria, Uganda, Pakistan, Afghanistan mediate facilitate dialogue among parties conflict, promote rule law, strengthen civil society education systems, educating public events, films, outreach. O USIP given $58 million grants 1,700 peacebuilding projects 76 countries. ® USIP hosts standing working groups experts practitioners variety issues, including Sudan, Syria, Korea, Iran, Iraq, Haiti. ® USIP facilitated number task forces, including Iraq Study Group recent Congressional Commission Strategic Posture United States, chaired William Perry. Michael H. Fuchs U.S. Department State (202) 647-1709

It's quite possibly best thing written SecState. We're getting around friends & family, along People op-ed NYT Mag q&a - great weekend terms positive press. It's 3 a.m. Do You Know Where Hillary Clinton Is? By David Rothkopf Washington Post Sunday, August 23, 2009 When comes Hillary Rodham Clinton, we're missing forest pantsuits. Clinton first celebrity become nation's top diplomat -- honor goes distant predecessor, Thomas Jefferson, time took office one famous gossiped-about men America -- may biggest. And first seven months office, former first lady, erstwhile presidential candidate eternal lightning rod drawn attention moods, looks, outtakes (of course) relationship husband for, well, work revamping nation's foreign policy. Even venerable publications -- one I regularly contribute, Foreign Policy -- woven all- Hillary-all-the-time coverage odd discussions Clinton's handbag scarf choices. Daily Beast editor Tina Brown, depicting Clinton supporter, scathing small-minded discussing things Clinton's weight hair, "defense" Hillary essay "Obama's Other Wife" sexist title suggests. Indeed, sexism followed Clinton campaign trail Foggy Bottom, seen recently posturing outrage surrounding exchange Congo Clinton reacted understandable frustration now-infamous question regarding husband's views. Major media outlets joined gossipfest, whether New York Times, covered Clinton's first big policy speech discussing whether White House, The Washington Post, couple reporters mused whether brew called Mad Bitch would beer choice secretary state. Amid distractions, Clinton actually doing? Only overseeing may profound changes U.S. foreign policy two decades -- transformation may render presidencies Bill Clinton George W. Bush mere side notes long transition meaningful post-Cold War worldview. The secretary quietly begun rethinking nature diplomacy translating vision revitalized State Department, one approaches U.S. allies rivals ways challenge long-held traditions. And despite pessimists invoked "team rivals" cliche predict President Obama Clinton would get along, Hillary defined role Obamaverse: often bad cop good cop, spine stiffener comes tough adversaries nurturer new strategies. Recognizing 3 a.m. phone calls going White House, instead tackling tough questions that, since end Cold War, kept America's leaders awake night. In early days new administration, easy focus Clinton achieved ways power supposedly constrained. Indeed, efforts frustrated difficult personnel approvals disputes White House get jobs. But way administrations. More unusual avidity new president seized reins foreign policy -- assertively either George W. Bush Bill Clinton him. Obama's centrality amplifies importance closest White House staffers, penchant appointing special envoys Richard Holbrooke (on Afghanistan Pakistan) George Mitchell (on Middle East) interpreted limiting Clinton's role. Given challenges involved, perhaps natural White House would bigger day-to-day hand nation's urgent foreign policy issues. But Obama, national security adviser Jim Jones, Vice President Joe Biden Secretary Defense Robert Gates absorbed Iraq, Afghanistan inherited problems recent past, Clinton's State Department take bigger role tackling problems future -- particular, America lead world century ahead. This approach necessary canny: It recognizes U.S. policy must change fulfill Obama's vision many high-profile issues Middle East often swamped careers aspirations secretaries state past. Which nations key partners? What many vital partners -- China, example, Russia -- rivals well? How must America's alliances change NATO stretched limit? How engage rogue states old enemies ways strengthen preserve prerogative challenge threats? How move beyond diplomacy men striped pants speaking governments embrace potent nonstate players once-disenfranchised peoples? In searching answers, Clinton leaving behind old doctrines labels. She outlined new thinking recent speech Council Foreign Relations New York, revealed stark differences new administration's worldview predecessors: The recurring themes include "partnership" "engagement" "common interests." Clearly, Madeleine Albright's "indispensable nation" recognized indispensability collaborating others. Who "others" area change greatest rapid. "We put," Clinton said, "special emphasis encouraging major emerging global powers -- China, India, Russia Brazil, well Turkey, Indonesia South Africa -- full partners tackling global agenda." This death knell G-8 head table global community; administration effort underway determine whether successor G-8 G-20, perhaps grouping. Though move away G-8 began waning days Bush era, administration viewed world different lens, perception evolved traditional great-power view pre-Galilean notion everything revolved around world's sole superpower. Obama Clinton made engaging emerging powers priority. Obama visited Russia earlier year host Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh first state dinner November. Clinton made trips China India, would Obama Russia injured elbow. Both visited Africa Middle East, reaching women Islamic world. On many critical agenda items -- rollback nuclear weapons climate trade talks -- emerging powers essential achieving U.S. goals. As result, we've seen new American willingness play old differences, whether Russia missile shield or, Clinton showed China trip, Beijing human rights. At center Clinton's brain trust Anne-Marie Slaughter, former dean Princeton's Woodrow Wilson School Public International Affairs. Now head policy planning State Department, Slaughter elaborated ideas Clinton's speech. "We envision getting new group states around table, also building networks, coalitions partnerships states nonstate actors tackle specific problems," told me. "To that," Slaughter continued, "our diplomats going need skills closer community organizing traditional reporting analysis. New connecting technologies vital tools kind diplomacy." A new team brought make changes real. Clinton recruited Alec Ross, one leaders Obama's technology policy team, seventh floor State Department senior adviser innovation. His mission harness new information tools advance U.S. interests -- task made easier Internet mobile networks played starring roles recent incidents, Iran Uighur uprising western China Moldova. Whether telecommunications program Congo protect women violence text messaging raise money Pakistani refugees Swat Valley, technology deployed reach new audiences. Of course, need new ideas revitalize State Department; need resources, too. The secretary brought former Bill Clinton-era budget chief Jack Lew help claw back money statecraft many Foggy Bottom feel sucked toward Pentagon. She also created special positions back new priorities, Melanne Verveer ambassador large women's issues, Elizabeth Bagley handle public-private outreach worldwide Todd Stern chief negotiator climate. Even months in, it's clear appointments far window dressing. Lew, Slaughter acting head U.S. Agency International Development leading effort rethink foreign aid new Quadrennial Diplomacy Development Review, initiative modeled Pentagon's strategic assessments designed review State's priorities. Stern conducted high-level discussions climate change around world, notably China. Clinton made women's issues centerpiece recent 11-day trip Africa, stressed "the social, political economic marginalization women across Africa left void continent undermines progress prosperity." Clinton also signaled importance private-sector experience naming former Goldman Sachs International vice chairman Robert Hormats, respected veteran four administrations, handle economic issues State Department, well Judith McHale, former chief executive Discovery Communications, run public diplomacy. In vein, opened Cuba American telecommunications companies reached India's private sector energy cooperation -- showing administration seek advance national interests tapping self-interests business community. As new administration, inevitable problems. The old campaign teams -- Clinton's Obama's -- still eye warily, feeling gradually fading. And accounts, administration's national security team come together successfully, Clinton developing strong relationships national security adviser Jones Defense Secretary Gates. Her policy deputy, Jim Steinberg, renewed old collaboration deputy national security adviser Tom Donilon; two them, working Obama campaign foreign policy advisers Denis McDonough Mark Lippert, formed one State Department seventh-floor dweller called "a powerful quartet heart real interagency policymaking." Henry Kissinger may overstated matters said best White House-State relationship recent memory, it's bad, State-Pentagon relationship best shape decades. At heart things, though, relationship Clinton Obama. For administration's talk international partnerships, may critical partnership all. So far, according multiple high-level officials State White House, two seem aligned views. In addition, gradually defining complementary roles. Obama assumed role principal spokesperson foreign policy, international audiences welcome new improved American brand. Clinton thus far echoed points also delivered tougher ones. Whether missile shield Iran North Korean saber-rattling, continued imprisonment Aung San Suu Kyi Burma rape corruption Congo, secretary state spoken bluntly world stage -- even triggered snide comments North Korea. It still early, president's foreign policy legacy often defined less big principles one reacts unexpected, whether missiles Cuba terrorism New York. Promising ideas fail limited attention reluctant bureaucracies, rhetoric eventually rings hollow, self-congratulatory "smart power" already me. Nevertheless, evidence that, seven months job, Obama's unlikely secretary state supporting augmenting agenda effectively. Not Obama's "other wife," Bill Clinton's wife, even celebrity former presidential candidate -- new role making. Holbrooke's Contributions Af/Pak Holbrooke assembled unprecedented interagency team carry work Af/Pak — whole-of-government team DC reorganized reenergized U.S. mission Kabul. Holbrooke's team actually getting things done, including implementation 20 detailed action plans. Some examples work thus far: • The civilian surge Afghanistan pace meet targets end year. • Our approach assistance Afghanistan changed dramatically, consolidation efforts Tony Wayne review (and sometimes rejection) assistance contracts. • • Holbrooke opened actively pursuing R/R channels. • The swift comprehensive U.S. response helped alleviate reduce impact Swat refugee crisis. • • The trilateral meetings helped create conditions progress key cross-border issues. )11 • Holbrooke's international diplomacy — Gulf, China, cadre special representatives — translated funding equipment commitments, buy-in, patience. Holbrooke key driver (non-military) strategic innovation Afghanistan Pakistan. Here examples:Ill Defining regional approach Af/Pak (including trilateral summits) • The regional approach championed Holbrooke became central feature Reidel report; trilats pure Holbrooke invention Afghanistan The clearest voice thinker swifter heavily resourced "Afghanization" - primarily standing sufficiently large sufficiently capable ANSF — preferable alternative adding troops. • The Reidel report calls training 134,000 army 82,000 police two years; Holbrooke working strategy would double numbers speed pace training. Such strategy resolve significant obstacles, particularly respect police. Framing executing U.S. approach Afghan elections: • Developing strategy — partnership Afghan government others — pursuing reconciliation/reintegration. • The Reidel report discusses support Afghan government's efforts reintegrate "non ideologically-committed" insurgents lay arms, renounce al Qaeda, accept Afghan Constitution. Holbrooke key developing aspect report, working next phases. Prioritizing shift emphasis counternarcotics eradication interdiction • The Reidel report discusses need increased interdiction efforts — attendant need support licit agriculture shift livelihoods. Emphasizing executing engagement Arab allies, China, Turkey • The Reidel report speaks generally engaging stake region. It lay specific diplomatic strategy priority countries. • [NOTE: • This issue get extensive treatment Reidel report. Pakistan • The Reidel report speak detail issue. Responding decisively refugee crisis Swat Buner • Obviously, Reidel report address this. The immediate response refugee crisis Holbrooke's team finest. Making image United States Pakistan critical strategic priority • The Reidel report focuses strategic communications Afghanistan. Holbrooke's recent trip Judith McHale latest ongoing effort develop strategic communications plan Pakistan. Generally, Holbrooke, along McDonough, key mover things related strategic communications Afghanistan Pakistan; good sense missing needed. Pursuing major new energy initiative address Pakistan's economic troubles boost support United States • The Reidel report mentions energy key sector encouraging foreign investment. 1. Hillary Clinton Pledges 'Banish Sexual Violence' Originally posted Friday August 21, 2009 12:30 PM EDT Secretary State Hillary Clinton may taking well-earned R&R Bermuda week, last week, former First Lady U.S. Senator wrapped grueling seven-nation diplomatic mission Africa. While much made back home snapping Congolese student asked Bill Clinton's thoughts trade issue ("My husband secretary state, I am," retorted), emotional heart tour also dangerous stop — Goma, inside war zone eastern Congo, tearfully met rape victims Aug. 11.In exclusive Op-Ed piece PEOPLE.com, Secretary Clinton shares learned visit - it. What I Saw Goma By Hillary Rodham Clinton In 11 days travel across Africa, I saw humanity worst — best. In Goma last week, I saw both. The Mugunga Internally Displaced Persons Camp sits land volcanoes great lakes edge Goma, provincial capital eastern Congo. The camp home 18,000 people seeking refuge cycle violent conflict left 5.4 million dead since 1998. Chased homes villages armed rebels informal militias, men, women children walked miles little food water reached relatively safe haven. Now live tents, one next other, row row, clinging life, others hanging whatever glimmer hope remains region plagued years brutality. Many people robbed homes, possessions, families and, worst all, dignity. Women girls particular victimized unimaginable scale, sexual gender-based violence become tactic war reached epidemic proportions. Some 1,100 rapes reported month, average 36 women girls raped every day. I visited hospital run organization Heal Africa met woman told eight months' pregnant attacked. She home group men broke in. They took husband two children shot front yard, returning house shoot two children. Then beat gang-raped left dead. But wasn't dead. She fought life neighbors managed get hospital — 85 kilometers away. I came Goma send clear message: The United States condemns attacks commit abet them. They crimes humanity. These acts don't harm single individual, single family, village, group. They shred fabric weaves us together human beings. Such atrocities place society. This truly humanity worst. But reason hope. We seen survivors summon courage rebuild lives communities. We seen civic leaders organizations come together combat appalling scourge. And seen health care workers sacrifice comfortable careers treat wounded Goma, I met doctors advocates work every day repair broken bodies spirits women raped, often gangs, often brutal fashion longer bear children, walk work. Caregivers like Lyn Lusi, founded Heal Africa Goma, Dr. Denis Mukwege, founded Panzi hospital Bukavu, represent humanity best. The United States stand brave people. This week I announced $17 million new funding prevent respond gender sexual violence Democratic Republic Congo. We provide medical care, counseling, economic assistance legal support. We dedicate nearly $3 million recruit train police officers protect women girls investigate sexual violence. We send technology experts help women front-line workers report abuse using photographs video share information treatment legal options. And deploy team civilian experts, medical personnel military engineers assess assist survivors sexual violence. While I DRC, I frank discussions sexual violence President Kabila. I stressed perpetrators crimes, matter are, must prosecuted punished. This particularly important positions authority, including members Congolese military, allowed commit crimes impunity. Our commitment survivors sexual gender-based violence begin visit Goma, end departure. We redoubling efforts address fundamental cause violence: fighting goes eastern Congo. We taking additional steps United Nations concert nations bring end conflict. There old Congolese proverb says, "No matter long night, day sure come." The day must come women eastern Congo walk freely again, tend fields, play children collect firewood water without fear. They live region unrivaled natural beauty rich resources. They strong resilient. They could, given opportunity, drive economic social progress would make country peaceful prosperous. Working together, banish sexual violence dark past, belongs, help Congolese people seize opportunities new day.
To state obvious, speaking Secretary State, mother audience mothers ---
To close loop: 1,100/month statistic comes UNICEF report widely accepted/used

The Senate Judiciary Committee last week reviewing amendment Sen. Richard Durbin (D-I11.) USA Patriot Act clarify legal standard needed investigation act. The amendment intended provide greater protections abuse investigators. His colleague, Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-Minn.), spoke opposition, agreeing committee Chairman Patrick Leahy (D-Vt.) ranking Republican Jeff Sessions (Ala.) additional protections needed. "I would point actual language here," Klobuchar said, "which is, it's like pie-in- the-sky standard here. I mean, specifically says," noted approvingly, reading aloud bill, "reasonable grounds believe information sought relevant authorized national security investigation," can't investigate someone exercising free speech rights there's got suspected foreign agent involved. "So I just, anyone listening this, like standard," concluded. "There standard place here." "That's standard bill now?" Sessions asked. Klobuchar nodded was. No it's not, Durbin interrupted. "Senator Klobuchar, read amendment," bill, said -- "and I think it's critically important understand we're establishing here." Whatever. Klobuchar voted amendment, got handful votes anyway. Blame gatekeeper The usual pattern State Department new secretary arrives Foggy Bottom first day work enters rousing cheers career Foreign Service folks hoping new boss actually heed expert advice. (They are, nature, optimistic crowd.) Then, 7 months, 8 days 12 hours, average, grumbling begins secretary "not accessible" senior career folks, she's overly protected personal staff, promised "open door" slammed shut. The fingers start pointing, usually secretary's chief staff. These days, that's Cheryl Mills, holds post Secretary State Hillary Rodham Clinton. We're hearing complaints even members inner circle overworked Mills -- chief staff, counselor, overseer Haiti policy food security policy department motor pool (okay, really) -- made entry Clinton's suite something like penetrating Green Zone Baghdad. Not so, says Undersecretary State William Burns, department's top career official. "This secretary touch every day many people across department possible, Cheryl big part making happen." Another senior State official said Clinton road lot: Asia July Africa August Ireland Moscow day, soon she'll back road, pretty much Thanksgiving. There also bunch meetings late AfPak matters. Hey, telling we're hearing. In timely fashion ... The Loop Better-Late-Than-Never award year goes State Department's personnel bureau. The bureau, Oct. 13 notice, said awarded $1.6 million contract Campion Services Inc. West Lafayette, Ind., "assist department ensuring examinations Foreign Service [jobs] professionally validated constitute reliable means identifying applicants greatest possibility success foreign service." Well, good thing department's hiring couple hundred years. The rest résumé The White House last week announced President Obama selected Jessie H. Roberson, nuclear expert senior vice president environmental affairs Atlantic Sea Island Group, member Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board. The bio notes previous jobs, even undergraduate degree nuclear engineering. Name sounds familiar. Roberson, Roberson: Wasn't Dubya's appointee assistant secretary Energy Department environmental management, $6 billion-a-year weapons cleanup program? That's mentioned White House release, 2001 2004. Waterboarding kids? WGDB, Part II: Sen. Tom Coburn (R-Okla.) must feeling stressed days travails pal, Sen. John Ensign (R-Nev.). For missed it, Coburn took Senate floor last week decry federal deficits, not, him, abstraction. "It deeply personal me," Coburn explained. "I five grandchildren. I look eyes, I see potential lives children there. You know what? We going waterboard them. That going do. We going waterboard them. We going flood debt. We going shackle opportunities. We going limit possibilities don't courage make difference future." Wait minute! It's dunk water. © 2009 The Washington Post Company

I've attached gorgeous cover PDF Hillary's Moment: Clinton Faces World By Joe Klein Time Magazine Wednesday, Nov. 04, 2009 It Halloween night Jerusalem, Benjamin Netanyahu came dressed peacemaker. "We're prepared start peace talks immediately," notoriously reluctant Israeli Prime Minister proclaimed, U.S. Secretary State Hillary Clinton standing side, poker-faced. "I think ... get get it." It ploy, course. The Palestinians tangled themselves, yet again. They elections looming, leader, Mahmoud Abbas, hang tough: demanding total freeze Israeli settlement-building West Bank — precisely Obama Administration previously said favored. Netanyahu offering partial freeze, including new settlements East Jerusalem, desired capital future Palestinian state. This nonstarter Palestinians, holographic glow step forward. It "unprecedented" offer, Netanyahu trumpeted, joy chess master springing trap.(See photos 60 years Israel.) It tough moment Clinton, playing second fiddle Bibi-does-Gandhi show. President Barack Obama softened language settlements weeks earlier: instead total freeze, talked Israeli "restraint" settlement-building. And Clinton seemed cement Administration's retreat, agreeing Netanyahu's proposal was, indeed, "unprecedented," even though U.S. still favored total freeze. The important thing, added, parties get table quickly possible. The onus back Palestinians — Palestinians quickly expressed outrage Obama Administration's retreat. Their Arab neighbors soon joined in, causing Clinton backtrack two days later, telling reporters Israeli plan "falls far short" U.S. expectations, although still insisted calling "unprecedented," neither diplomatic wise. Suddenly Obama Administration seemed wobbly Middle East; clearly, Clinton bullish Netanyahu's proposal (which negotiated months Middle East envoy George Mitchell seen, privately, Americans real progress). But Administration's mission get parties peace talks without preconditions. The Israelis favor talks. The Palestinians setting preconditions. And Clinton violated essential rule job: boring almost always better.(See photos life career former Secretary State Madeleine Albright.) Clinton's Three Qualities For past 40 years, awkward Middle East press conference helped define job Secretary State. You go Jerusalem Ramallah; stand "guardedly optimistic" public; private, try move comma, Israelis Palestinians move, semicolon block comma. The result almost always same: gridlock. The breakthroughs, come, emanate others. Walter Cronkite asks Anwar Sadat he'd willing go Jerusalem ... Sadat, everyone's surprise, says yes. The Israelis Palestinians hold secret meetings Oslo reach appears breakthrough — they're talking! — becomes another dead end. The job Secretary State thankless glamorous; ways, Department State, noble antique, still trying come terms invention telephone. In era Twitter haiku-messaging rules, diplomacy moves speed, requires nuanced complexity, literature. Power drifted State National Security Council Pentagon, especially wartime. Only Clinton's recent predecessors distinguished themselves. Henry Kissinger, National Security Adviser belatedly became Secretary State, Richard Nixon's schizophrenic alter ego; George Shultz strong policy voice Reagan Administration; James Baker clout George H.W. Bush's best friend world-class dealmaker. Most others frustrated forgettable. And yet Hillary Clinton we're talking — second popular American world, eternally compelling supremely talented character, subject constant speculation, walking headline. Her presence job makes crucial more. It cliché say naming Clinton, Obama brought popular potential opponent tent. The conventional wisdom, cynical half, thereby succeeded neutering her, theory bolstered Clinton's reticence first nine months job, special envoys like Mitchell Richard Holbrooke heavy lifting diplomacy. But naming Clinton, Obama also gave great power, cuts ways: becomes dissatisfied role Administration's policies, become torpedo aimed Oval Office. Colin Powell similar power real gripe — Iraq war — never used it. Clinton gripe, Obama Administration settles policy differences begin emerge among key players, Powell conundrum looms: How Clinton choose use power? How Obama react does? Traditionally, Secretary State judged ability formulate policy, negotiate deals manage striped-pants bureaucracy. Clinton history global strategist, although performance 2008 campaign indicates bit conservative President, foreign policy realist Wilsonian idealist. It also early judge skill manager negotiator — although performance Jerusalem indicates needs lessons Middle East Haggling 101. There are, however, three qualities could make memorable Secretary State. She brings vision departmental reform — need elevate foreign aid programs status rigorous scrutiny diplomacy — could change striped pants chinos developing world. She also first elected politician hold office since Edmund Muskie briefly Carter Administration, enabled better understand interact politicians run places like Afghanistan Pakistan. But important, international celebrity much higher profile recent predecessors ability — second President's — change negative attitudes U.S. abroad. She potential become powerful public diplomat U.S. fielded quite time, although performance far, home abroad, occasionally perplexing. At home, often seemed tentative deferential. In conversation Secretary Defense Robert Gates aired CNN early October, Clinton's cautious formality took backseat Gates' brisk, humorous confidence policy issues. Abroad, seems far confident, times point recklessness, Jerusalem. (See photos last days Hillary Clinton's campaign.) Independence Candor In last week October, Secretary Clinton moved squarely center world stage, attempting, behest special envoys, improve rocky alliance Pakistan nudge Middle East pugilists talks. In course trip, first stray wisps hint Clinton wanted begin asserting independence, Administration, facing roadblocks across world, struggled firmer foreign policy tone opening nine months might called Rodney King — "Can't get along?" — phase. During three days Pakistan, ran gauntlet town-hall meetings media interviews may unprecedented, use word week, U.S. Secretary State. The trip, planned Holbrooke Pakistan specialist Vali Nasr, offered unusually subtle itinerary U.S. diplomatic mission. A visit Sufi mosque bombed Sunni extremists, example, sent powerful message Pakistan's moderate Islamic majority. "We saw praying there," academic named Shala Aziz told me, "and, first time, I'm thinking, The Americans hearts."(See photos suicide bombings Islamabad.) The big news Clinton allowed hammered hostile questions students, talk-show hosts Pashturi elders -- that, occasion, pushed back, raising incredibly sensitive issues, like one Pakistani government knew Osama bin Laden was, even though country since 2002. Press accounts either emphasized embarrassment Secretary State's getting pummeled fixed Clinton's undiplomatic bluntness. But missed point: candor, willingness listen acknowledge criticism, begun undermine prevailing Pakistani image U.S. arrogant bossy, interested Pakistani military fight war al-Qaeda Taliban true strategic partnership. The contrast especially sharp George W. Bush's eight years unqualified support military dictatorship Pervez Musharraf. "In past, Americans came, would talk generals go home," said Farahnaz Ispahani, government spokeswoman Member Parliament. "Clinton's willingness meet everyone, hostile not, made big impression — she's Hillary Clinton, real history affinity country, means much more." Transformative Experience There toasts state dinners Pakistan, alcohol. There opening statements, though, Clinton's — delivered impromptu first night trip tossing aside notes — surprisingly emotional. Earlier day, President Asif Ali Zardari, widower Benazir Bhutto, presented Secretary album photos first visit Pakistan, 1995, framed photo Bhutto two sons Clinton daughter Chelsea. "It bring tears eyes," Clinton said state dinner honor presidential palace, "because I admired wife. She gave life ..." She faltered then, choking up, quickly pulled together, talking "reasons — provide opportunities all." Clinton's first trip Pakistan First Lady 1995 transformative experience — beginning, I believe, the•process made plausible candidate Secretary State. I traveled trip; set off, seemed depressed even private usual. The Democrats cratered 1994 congressional elections, trounced efforts enact universal health care plan. It personal defeat; Clinton traveled country trying sell plan, crowds shouted cursed her. Privately admitted shocked hatred. The trip South Asia seemed bit vacation — Chelsea's spring break — also retreat demure, First Lady–like role two years health care policy czar, although proceeded decidedly wonky, Hillarian fashion. Jackie Kennedy gone India famously ridden elephant; Hillary Clinton traveled five countries packed schedule visits NGOs. "That greatest trip, unbelievable," Clinton says now. We sitting hotel suite day Jerusalem gaffe, Secretary electric-blue shift rather usual formal jacket pants. She wearing glasses appeared rather freckly without makeup. "I guess trip animated informed everything I've done since," said. She emerged trip reinvigorated, new mission. By end 1995, U.N. Conference Women Beijing, First Lady propounded new Clinton Doctrine: "Women's rights human rights."(See photos Beijing's changing skyline.) Clinton easy interview. She preternaturally cautious, consequence Methodist propriety 20 years insane public scrutiny. She like talk herself, tell one interesting story Bhutto. When husband governor Arkansas, Bill Chelsea visited London stood sidewalk outside Bhutto's hotel, waiting Pakistani Prime Minister arrive. "She wearing yellow embroidered shalwar kameez chiffon scarf. I fan, standing sidewalk everyone else. It time I ever anything like that," Clinton says. When Clinton Bhutto met formally, first day 1995 trip, hit immediately, part Bhutto also obsessed impact Islamist tide women children. I remember asking Bhutto day biggest change country past 25 years, said, "I used able walk street wearing jeans, without headscarf. Now I can't." When I asked why, said — bluntly — "The Saudis," aggressively funding religious schools. Of course, Bhutto's acquiescence to, participation in, general corruption Pakistani government part reason public schools inadequate madrasahs became popular. (See photos aftermath Benazir Bhutto's assassination 2007.) Ironically, rise Sunni extremist groups like al-Qaeda brought Clinton's interests — microfinance, education health care — center national-security policy first time. The impetus came State Department military, counterinsurgency doctrine demanded social services war zones - schools, justice, economic development — reinforce military's efforts secure population. As result, immediate chemistry Clinton General David Petraeus, author Army's counterinsurgency manual, became one prime military mentors served Senate Armed Services Committee. At one point, well Obama made presidential intentions known, I asked Petraeus potential Democratic candidate understood mind worked, said, "You mean, aside Hillary?" It Clinton brought together Petraeus Holbrooke ("my two alpha males," calls them) first time - home Washington Friday Obama Inauguration. The affection respect gained military serving Senate helped make relationship State Pentagon less fraught usual — although Defense Secretary Gates' insistence need bigger State Department budgets hasn't hurt. In fact, relations Pentagon gone smoother, times, Clinton's relationship White House staff. Clinton particularly irritated ridiculously strict vetting process thwarted favored candidate USAID director, Paul Farmer, getting job. "It sorts niggling things," says Clinton adviser, "like, Farmer one point brought $10,000 cash Haiti. The money needle-exchange program, amount illegal." Another Clinton's military mentors, retired General Jack Keane, told me, "I'm Republican. I disagree practically everything, she'd make hell Commander Chief." There palpable toughness woman, hard edge contrasts President's instinctive impulse toward conciliation. One sharpest exchanges presidential campaign came Obama accused Clinton echoing "bluster" George W. Bush said U.S. would able "obliterate" Iran used nuclear weapons Israel. Clinton's edgier tone evident start Administration: took sharper position President Israeli settlement freeze claiming, May, Obama wanted "to see stop settlements. Not settlements, outposts, natural-growth exceptions." And then, Jerusalem, use word unprecedented seemed rhetorical leap beyond No Drama ground rules.(Read "Clinton's Collateral Damage.") The White House entirely thrilled either statement. But White House staff several steps removed negotiating process. The Palestinians weak divided. The Israelis difficult, always: whenever Mitchell raises East Jerusalem talks Israeli Foreign Minister, Israeli stands walks room. Despite Netanyahu's momentary, tactical enthusiasm peace talks, Likud Party always favored de facto incorporation Palestinian lands state Israel. Hillary's Choice The tensions White House State raise fascinating question going forward. Obama Clinton substantive agreement President's diplomacy-first philosophy policy issues — although neither willing disclose content private conversations — style often predicts substance foreign policy; neither Obama's gauziness Clinton's inconsistent bluntness overseas seems particularly solid. There growing perception Administration's policies thwarted across board: Afghanistan mess, Iran seems ready scuttle nuclear negotiations, there's progress Middle East, Syrians North Koreans remain recalcitrant, Russians offered freebie missile defense, Chinese given pass human rights apparent quid pro quos. The White House argues progress made: Iran defensive, North Korea said return six-party talks. Clinton argues, correctly, need "strategic patience." But thing Obama really show efforts far Nobel Prize Potential — small thing — wisdom refrained anything wildly stupid invading Iraq. The President willing use military force - Predator drones decimated al-Qaeda's leadership testify lack squeamishness — Administration supposed efficacy using subtler expressions of.U.S. power. That doesn't happen overnight, Obama's policies considered success, happen sooner later, way explained public. There also growing sense President's inexperience beginning show — overall policy, represents views broad, moderate national-security consensus ranging Brent Scowcroft John Kerry, execution details. The Afghan strategy review public taken long; Middle East peace hunt become wild goose chase. A letter Iran's Supreme Leader productive gesture gets response; doesn't, seems weak supplicatory. A call Israelis freeze settlements effective accompanied credible threat reduction aid. "You can't seen pushing countries around — demanding [that] Israel freeze settlements, demanding Hamid Karzai reform government — get results," says Leslie H. Gelb, author Power Rules. "The leaders countries tough, successful politicians, they'll begin take less seriously." (See photos 1979 revolution Iran.) Clinton unwilling acknowledge problems, staff loath admit occasional mistakes. Her praise President fulsome, aides say relationship Obama really — really — strong. But also burblings emanations Clinton's staff friends, Foggy Bottom body language, suggest need Administration produce second act Rodney King phase. And White House perplexed uncharacteristic lack discipline indicated Clinton's occasional overseas gaffes. These tensions well within boundaries normal, creative policymaking. There absolutely indication Secretary frustrated point jumping ship — returning politics candidate governor New York, rumored. Quite contrary, seems intent making history Secretary State. To that, though, authority home abroad. She become President's primary foreign policy voice. Over first nine months Obama Administration, seven different Obama officials spoken Sunday talk shows foreign policy. Clinton Sunday shows once. "Either one person sending foreign policy message, clear approval President," says former Republican Secretary State, "or message."(See photos eight months Obama's diplomacy.) Aides Obama say would like see Sunday shows often. (Indeed, Clinton's staff acknowledged asked appear two additional times traveling unable so.) Ultimately, though, television metaphor larger questions need resolved: How much former rivals — extremely guarded private people — really trust other; and, Clinton, emerge President's alter ego foreign policy? At point, strongest member Obama's national-security team Gates — he's Republican unlikely spokesman presidential confidant anything beyond Pentagon issues. General Jim Jones settled National Security Adviser, he's political animal — every President needs close foreign policy adviser understands intersection long-term strategy, politics diplomatic chess. Clinton's value Administration clear Pakistan. She wowed public skeptical questioning $7.5 billion purely economic humanitarian aid Administration promised. "How much damage control able trip?" asked Meher Bokhari, television-news-show host, end Clinton's meeting Pakistani women. The Secretary seemed nonplussed bluntness question. "I don't know," said. "I hope some." Afterward, I asked Bokhari answer question. "Well, trip long overdue," said. Millennium Challenge Corporation THE WHITE HOUSE Office Press Secretary FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE November 6, 2009 President Obama Taps Cassandra Butts Serve Senior Advisor Millennium Challenge Corporation WASHINGTON - Today, President Barack Obama announced name Deputy White House Counsel Cassandra Q. Butts Senior Advisor Office Chief Executive Officer Millennium Challenge Corporation. President Obama said, "I honored appoint dear friend trusted colleague Cassandra serve important role. The Millennium Challenge Corporation essential partner work combat global poverty, Cassandra brings depth experience true passion justice invaluable success future. I grateful Cassandra's tireless service administration look forward continuing work years ahead." President Obama made following announcement today: Cassandra Q. Butts, Senior Advisor, Office Chief Executive Officer, Millennium Challenge Corporation Cassandra Butts currently Deputy White House Counsel focused judicial nominations. Ms. Butts general counsel Obama-Biden Transition Project. She also served Senior Vice President Domestic Policy Center American Progress. Prior joining CAP, senior advisor House Democratic Leader Richard A. Gephardt (D-MO) worked refugee, asylum immigration issues served policy director 2004 presidential campaign. Ms. Butts also served director Senator Obama's Senate transition 2004-2005. Previously, Assistant Counsel NAACP Legal Defense & Educational Fund also served Legislative Counsel Senator Harris L. Wofford (D-PA). Ms. Butts international election observer Zimbabwean parliamentary elections 2000. She graduate Harvard Law School University North Carolina Chapel Hill. ###

WASHINGTON (CNN) — Fewer three 10 Americans think Sarah Palin's qualified president, according new national poll - least five potential candidates included survey. But another woman tops list CNN/Opinion Research Corporation survey released Monday: two-thirds public thinks Secretary State Hillary Clinton's qualified Oval Office. That's Vice President Joe Biden, who's currently next line presidency. According poll, 28 percent Americans say Palin qualified run White House, seven 10 saying former Alaska governor 2008 Republican vice presidential nominee qualified. The survey indicates majority Republicans, 54 percent, feel Palin qualified, 44 percent indicating isn't. But 29 percent independent voters questioned feel qualified serve president, 68 percent disagreeing. According poll, nine 10 Democrats feel Palin qualified. The poll's release comes one day release Palin's book, "Going Rogue: An American Life." "The perception Palin qualified president puts significantly behind two potential rivals GOP nomination 2012 - Mitt Romney Mike Huckabee," says CNN Polling Director Keating Holland. According survey, nearly half Americans think Romney qualified president, 43 percent feeling way Huckabee. Among Republicans, Palin still lagging potential 2012 primary candidates: 63 percent GOPers think Romney Huckabee qualified, 9 points higher number say Palin." Palin many strengths - recent CNN polls indicate Americans believe typical politician, cares average Americans, honest trustworthy," says Holland. "But perception qualified White House biggest Achilles heel."An ABC News/Washington Post poll also released Monday indicates 38 percent Americans say Palin's qualified serve president, six 10 saying she's qualified. The CNN survey indicates 67 percent people questioned say Clinton qualified serve Oval Office, 17 points higher 50 percent Americans think Biden's qualified take president.Biden's low number may attributable negative feelings Obama/Biden administration rather views Biden personally." In past, poll respondents dislike administration sometimes taken vice president," say Holland. Polls late 1990s showed Americans felt Al Gore qualified president, respondents given chance say something negative Gore unrelated qualifications, adds. In Bush administration, number thought Dick Cheney qualified president dropped administration grew unpopular. "Cheney's experience office didn't change period - attitudes toward Bush/Cheney administration did," says. Hillary Clinton also advantage able stay domestic policy debates, including health care, economic stimulus, controversial matters, adding almost daily experience foreign policy, Holland adds, Biden involved domestic policy disputes - "which might explain respondents looking reason say something negative veep." The CNN/Opinion Research Corporation poll conducted November 13-15, 1,014 adult Americans questioned telephone. The survey's sampling error plus minus 3 percentage points overall sample.

ill Ex-Gates Foundation exec named foreign aid chief Obama administration picks former Gates Foundation official run US foreign aid By MATTHEW LEE Associated Press ij 11-10-2009 13:46 11 SINGAPORE (AP) _ The Obama administration nominate young former executive Bill Melinda Gates Foundation run America's top foreign assistance program, ending months speculation complaints would take vacant post, U.S. officials said Tuesday. $ President Barack Obama chosen Rajiv Shah, medical doctor currently senior official Department Agriculture dealing food security, run U.S. Agency International Development, officials said. ¶ The officials spoke condition anonymity pending notification Congress formal public announcement choice. 11 Shah's selection, must still confirmed Senate, would end 10-month leadership vacuum USAID, operating acting director since Obama took office despite campaign pledges agency play greater role foreign policy. 11 Obama Secretary State Hillary Rodham Clinton said USAID crucial deploying preferred "smart power" foreign policy strategy, envisions equal roles diplomacy development alongside defense. They plan double amount foreign aid. 11 The agency play key role administration's efforts Afghanistan Pakistan, officials believe civilian component must strengthened. $ But top job agency remained vacant now, several prime candidates' withdrawing consideration amid White House vetting process Clinton denounced July "ridiculous," "a nightmare," "frustrating beyond words." $ Shah, 36, whose family immigrated U.S. India, Under Secretary Research, Education Economics Chief Scientist Agriculture Department manages budget $2.6 billion 10,000 staff around world. ¶ Before that, several positions Bill Melinda Gates Foundation, including managing $1.5 billion contribution global vaccination fund helping launch foundation's Global Development program oversaw $1.3 billion investment portfolio. The lingering USAID vacancy, particularly several leading candidates pulled out, upset development experts Congress. Some lawmakers suggested Obama choose someone already gone vetting process. ¶ Shah fits bill important political credentials, worked several leading Democratic politicians. il

Mills, Cheryl D <MillsCD@state.gov> Monday, September 14, 2009 10:51 AM H FW: Hitting Bottom Foggy Bottom RELEASE IN FULL FP FortAgn Policy Hitting Bottom Foggy Bottom The State Department suffers low morale, bottlenecks, bureaucratic ineptitude. Do need kill save it? BY MATTHEW ARMSTRONG I SEPTEMBER 11, 2009 Discussion fate Foggy Bottom usually focuses tenure Secretary State Hillary Clinton, troubles public diplomacy, rise special envoys everything European pipelines Afghanistan Pakistan. But Americans would benefit reassessment core functionality U.S. State Department. Years neglect marginalization, well dearth long-term vision strategic planning, left 19th- century institution hamstrung fiefdoms bureaucratic bottlenecks. The Pentagon funds controls wide range foreign-policy diplomatic priorities -- development public diplomacy beyond. The world changed, everyone politicians talking heads terrorists directly influencing global audiences. The pressing issues stateless: pandemics, recession, terrorism, poverty, proliferation, conflict. But report report, investigation investigation, highlighted, State Department broken paralyzed, unable respond new 21st-century paradigm. But get bad? Is possible fix? Or push wall like great Humpty Dumpty reassign pieces? There growing evidence internal machinations State Department corrupted "core missions" traditional diplomacy public diplomacy. This year, example, Government Accountability Office (gao) found department completely failed four-year-old attempt reorganize nonproliferation bureau (a bureau remains leaderless). Besides failing address mission overlap, low morale, lack career opportunities, failed reorganization caused significant drop expertise offices focused proliferation issues -- including "today's threats posted Iran, North Korea, Syria," gao's report said -- coordination bodies like International Atomic Energy Agency. Another report State Department's inspector general year described severe broad dysfunction within Africa bureau, ignoring -- perhaps considering given -- lack departmentwide integration leadership operations. Examples dysfunction range providing public diplomacy personnel computers capable reading interoffice memos failure effectively work new Africa Command. By necessity, Defense Department stepped State Department tuned out: Foggy Bottom relies Pentagon funding even personnel basic operations central mission. For example, Defense Department performs much strategic communications work traditionally purview State Department. In Somalia, example, State Department's budget public diplomacy $30,000. The Pentagon's $600,000. And, State Department's bureaucratic wisdom, $30,000 even belong undersecretary public diplomacy public affairs. Further, rivalries different "cones" -- career tracks, referred one insider "conal caste system" -- State Department severely impact morale, career growth, even operations. The report Africa bureau noted 2002, public affairs public diplomacy "failed office" -- situation worse 2009. Public outreach workers said bureau's leadership "does understand public diplomacy." The sentiment widespread. A 2008 report congressional ombudsman, U.S. Advisory Commission Public Diplomacy, described systemic failure support train public diplomacy officers field, well professional discrimination career track. Attempts fix State Department focused short-term issues, ameliorating shortages human financial resources. The last eight secretaries state attempted bolster department bolstering bottom line. No less Defense Secretary Robert Gates chairman Joint Chiefs Staff, Adm. Mike Mullen, long suggested transferring funds Defense Department State Department. But situation dire State Department, point, could even absorb spend much-needed infusion cash. If wholesale transfer funds tomorrow, lack capacity skills State department would mean would give back Defenk Department dole contractors. The creeping militarization U.S. foreign policy deeply worrying, Gates Mullen, also luminaries Secretary Clinton Vice President Joe Biden. In 2008, then-Senator Biden questioned "expanding role military U.S. foreign policy." He said concerned "migration functions authorities U.S. civilian agencies Department Defense." Some commentators even wondered aloud whether best way fix State Department might destroy it. Foggy Bottom could retain small core staff embassies ambassadors. All functions -- public diplomacy, countering misinformation propaganda, development, including provincial reconstruction staffing -- could migrate Pentagon become wholly independent agencies. But atomizing State Department would ultimately prove dangerous militarization foreign policy. The Pentagon needs counterbalance, vertically integrated State Department president, Congress, U.S. public count on. Change, rather creative destruction, Foggy Bottom needs. Envision State Department capable leading whole-of-government initiatives strategic focus instead one hidebound department geared structure tradition execute state-to-state diplomacy. This "Department State Non-State" would deft tackling stateless terrorist networks hurricanes would fostering upholding alliances foreign ministers. To transform Foggy Bottom way require breaking rigid hierarchy, stovepipes, bottlenecks make Pentagon look lean dynamic comparison. Modern global affairs compartmentalized political borders. Besides expanding overly shallow narrow authorities public diplomacy bureau, Clinton must restructure State Department focus less countries regions. Currently, Foggy Bottom's regional bureaus, Near East Affairs, configured oversee patch embassies. Country desk officers, ambassadors, report assistant secretary, regional head. The assistant secretary turn reports undersecretary, reports Clinton. Clinton name regional bureau heads, currently assistant secretaries, undersecretary status. This would help eliminate unnecessary bureaucratic layer would also align State Department Defense Department (which powerful regional commands, Centcom Africom). The State Department's regional leaders would hold equivalent civilian rank four-star combatant commanders like Gen. David Petraeus. These changes would promise improve communications, synchronize missions, put department right path today's requirements. But Clinton beware reforming State Department quickly within -- efforts could paralyzed bureaucracy mutiny would simply wait out. U.S. national security would suffer Pentagon's growing power would become entrenched. Clinton need clear unequivocal support president importantly Congress, authorizes State Department spending bills, chance success. In burst activity Barack Obama's election, Congress authorized money people State Department pushed greater public diplomacy. Still required. The question asked last eight years State Department abrogated various responsibilities -- Defense, who? -- not, indeed cannot, answered department steps plate becomes effective visible leading implementing U.S. foreign policy. This take time. But, saying goes, time like present. The United States Congress supports change, secretaries state defense want change, president whose entire election platform built around word "change," American public would outraged dysfunction knew details. 3

Brazil signals recognition Honduran election (AP) –40 minutes ago RIO DE JANEIRO —A top Brazilian official signaled Latin America's largest nation may recognize Honduran candidate won last weekend's post-coup presidential election. Dilma Rousseff chief staff Brazilian President Luiz !neck) Lula da Silva. Rousseff says Central American country's Nov. 29 election considered separately June 28 coup ousted ex-President Manuel Zelaya. Previously, government said would recognize election unless Zelaya returned office allowed serve term, ends Jan. 27. Rousseff told Brazilian television late Friday Germany coup "is one thing" "discussing election" another. She says "this new process" — election — "has considered."

Cheryl Mills < Sunday, December 6, 2009 9:39 PM Fwd: Charles Blow NYT today EF1 December 5, 2009 Op-Ed Columnist Black Age Obama By CHARLES M. BLOW A hundred fifty years ago, Charles Dickens opened "A Tale Two Cities" now-famous phrase: "It best times, worst times. ..." Those words resonated recently contemplating impact Obama presidency blacks America. So far, it's mixed. Blacks living tale two Americas — one ascension first black president cultural capital accrues; collapsing quality life amplified racial tensions, supporting president loath even acknowledge pain, let alone commiserate it. Last year, blacks dared dream anew, envisioning future Obama's election would catalyst era prosperity racial harmony. Now election's afterglow nearly faded, hysteria hope ground hard stone reality. Things gotten better. In many ways, they've gotten worse. The recession, one, dealt particularly punishing uneven hand blacks. A May report Pew Research Center found blacks likely get higher-priced subprime loans, leading higher foreclosure rates. In fact, blacks displaced Hispanics group lowest homeownership rates. According recent jobs data, unemployment rate blacks nearly twice whites, gap important demographics widened rapidly since Obama took office. The unemployment rate time white college graduates 24 years old grew 20 percent. For black cohorts, rate grew twice much. And report published last month Department Agriculture found 2008, "food insecurity" American households risen record levels, black children likely experience food insecurity. Things racial front bad. We inundated examples overt racism scale unaccustomed. Any protester racist poster hijack news cycle, racist image live forever Internet. In fact, racially offensive images first couple prolific online Google runs apologetic ad results image searches them. And it's words images; it's actions well. According Federal Bureau Investigation's 2008 hate crimes data released last week, anti-black hate crimes rose 4 percent 2007, combined hate crimes racial categories declined 11 percent. If look two-year trend, would include Obarna's ascension candidate, anti-black hate crimes risen 8 percent, racial groups fallen 19 percent. This sobering effect blacks. According Nov. 9 report Gallup, last summer 23 percent blacks thought race relations would get lot better election Obama. Now less half percentage says things actually gotten lot better. The racial animosity Obama's election stirred may contributed rallying effect among blacks. According Gallup report published Nov. 24, Obama's approval rating among whites dropped 39 percent, among blacks remains 90 percent. Also, hasn't exactly good year black men news. Plaxico Burress locked accidentally shooting gun club. Henry Louis Gates Jr. locked intentionally shooting mouth home. And Michael Jackson died shot full propofol. Chris Brown brutally beat Rihanna. Former Representative William Jefferson convicted. And recently, "personal failings" Tiger Woods portray alley cat. Meanwhile, critically acclaimed black movie year, "Precious," features black man rapes twice impregnates daughter. Rooting president feels like nice counterbalance. However, rallying creates conundrum blacks: air anxiety without arming Obama's enemies. This dilemma rendered blacks virtually voiceless pressing issues time voices would presumably held greater sway. This means Obama get away almost nothing specifically address issues important African-Americans instead focus white voters he's losing droves. This gone unnoticed. In Nov. 9 Gallup poll, number blacks felt Obama would go far enough promoting efforts aid black community jumped 60 percent last summer now. The hard truth Obama needs white voters needs black ones. According analysis, even every black person America stayed home Election Day, Obama would still president. To large degree, Obama elected white people, able accept consciously portrayed racially ambiguous. In fact, commiserating blacks could prove politically problematic. In study published journal Proceedings National Academy Sciences month, researchers asked subjects rate images president determine ones best represented "true essence." In photos, skin lightened. In others, darkened. The result? The people identified "whiter" images, likely voted him, vice versa. The Age Obama, far least, seems less Obama black community game-changer White House gamesman. It's unclear positive Obama Effect, Obama Backlash increasingly apparent. Meanwhile, black people also living tale two actions: grin bear it. Forwarded message

Politico Poll: Clinton approval soars By: Eamon Javers December 16, 2009 03:00 PM EST A new poll avid news watchers shows Secretary State Hillary Clinton much higher approval rating man campaigned works for, President Barack Obama. In poll 800 registered voters self-identified "news watchers," Clinton 75 percent approval rating 21 percent disapproval rating overall. Obama, contrast, 51 percent approval 45 percent disapproval rating. The Secretary State conducted several well-received foreign trips recent months closely identified contentious elements Administration's agenda, including health care fight, federal deficit Wall Street bailouts. And subjected nearly media partisan scrutiny president. Obama, meanwhile, national television daily basis tackling wide range difficult issues. The poll conducted nonpartisan Clarus Research Group December 7th 12th, asked opinions top Cabinet secretaries White House officials. Its finding Obama Clinton mirrors earlier polls — October, example, Gallup poll found Clinton become popular president. Clarus president Ron Faucheux said one reason Clinton's high poll numbers high approval among Republicans — numbers said position well run president future, chooses. Clinton 96 percent approval among Democrats, healthy 57 percent approval among Republicans, 65 percent approval among Independents. Obama nearly popular among Democrats — 93 percent — numbers among Republicans Independents fell dramatically, 19 percent 33 percent respectively. Clinton's Republican numbers striking, given intensely disliked past among GOP voters. In fact, part Obama's appeal Democratic primary voters 2008 likely able bridge partisan divide Clinton, well-known figure dating time first lady 1990s. "Republicans may see hawkish Democrats foreign policy issues," said Faucheux. "It may way bolster position within administration." Asked future Clinton presidential bid, said, "She's good shape now." The next highest-rated cabinet secretary survey Defense Secretary Robert Gates, notched 69 percent overall approval rate 78 percent approval among Democrats 63 percent among Republicans independents. "Both Clinton Gates well across partisan board," said Faucheux. "Everybody else well among Democrats fell among Republicans." Another trend spotted pollsters: Approval ratings inside Beltway higher rest country. "These results show 'Beltway echo chamber' reflect rest country, even among news watchers," said Faucheux. Among White House staffers advisors, Press Secretary Robert Gibbs — often seen television — highest overall rating 50 percent. Economic advisor Larry Summers lowest approval, 25 percent. Summers Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithner — closely associated economy — posted higher disapproval numbers approval. Summers' disapproval rating 41 percent. Geithner's disapproval rating 45 percent, one point higher approval rating. The poll also found White House Chief Staff Rahm Emanuel, often viewed sharp partisan elbows, scored much higher among Democrats, 72 percent, Republicans, 13 percent. Among major administration officials, Vice President Joe Biden 50 percent approval 41 percent disapproval rating; Attorney General Eric Holder HHS Secretary Kathleen Sebelius posted 41 percent approval 35 percent disapproval; Presidential Adviser David Axelrod scored 38 percent approval 36 percent disapproval; National Security Adviser James Jones 30 percent approval 23 percent disapproval rating. Afghan speech FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE September 11, 2009 Contact: Senator Levin's Office Phone: 202.224.6221 Senate Floor Speech - Surge Afghan Army Remarks prepared delivery Today mark solemn anniversary. Eight years ago morning, nation attacked terrorist extremists motivated hatred bent destruction. It always appropriate remember shock day, innocent lives lost, efforts nation made since day ensure Afghanistan, nation hosted terrorists, cannot become safe haven terrorists seeking attack us. But today especially appropriate occasion take stock efforts, consider best continue them. I recently returned trip Afghanistan, I joined colleagues Senators Jack Reed Ted Kaufman. The situation Afghanistan serious. Security deteriorated. But take right steps, ensure Afghanistan revert Taliban-friendly government could provide safe haven al Qaeda terrorize us world. The Obama administration's new strategy, focusing securing Afghan population's safety partnering Afghan security forces effort, important start reversing situation Afghanistan. The change strategy led forces, words General McChrystal's Counterinsurgency Guidance, "live, eat train together [with Afghan security forces], plan operate together, depend one another, hold accountable....and treat equal partners success." The Guidance goes say success Afghan security forces "is goal." To achieve goal increase accelerate efforts support Afghan security forces efforts become self-sufficient delivering security nation — consider whether increase U.S. combat forces levels already planned next months. These steps include increasing size Afghan Army police much faster presently planned; providing trainers Afghan Army police presently planned; providing equipment presently planned; working separate local Taliban fighters leaders attract side government Iraq. While security situation Afghanistan worsened, still important advantages there. The Afghan people hate Taliban. Public opinion polls show support Taliban 5%. In addition, Afghan army highly motivated troops proven fighters. Despite advantages, face significant challenges. General McChrystal believes, I agree, need regain initiative create momentum towards success. General McChrystal worries, rightly so, perception lost initiative, impact perception Afghan people, government, al Qaeda Taliban. By contrast, dispel perception, chance convince local lower- level Taliban fighters lay arms rejoin Afghan society. I believe effective way retake initiative Afghanistan series steps ensure Afghanistan's army police manpower, equipment support secure nation. First, increase troop levels Afghan army police faster currently planned. There approximately 90,000 troops Afghan army now, number scheduled go 134,000 October 2010. The Afghan police scheduled reach level 82,000 time. For long time, many us urged establishment goal 240,000 Afghan troops 160,000 Afghan police 2013. The Afghan Minister Defense strongly supported numbers. It appears government Afghan government prepared accept goals. But need additional Afghan forces urgent. I believe possible essential advance goals year, 2012. Our military Afghanistan repeatedly pointed need Afghan forces. In one sector Helmand province visited last week, Marines outnumbered Afghan soldiers 5 one. A Marine Company commander Helmand province told New York Times July lack Afghan troops "is absolutely Achilles heel." What need increase size Afghan army police? According Afghan Defense Minister Wardak, lack Afghan manpower; we've assured available. But need significantly trainers. We asked General Formica, charge American effort train Afghan security forces, whether increase possible. He indicated would make assessment would necessary order meet earlier timetable. In meantime, also press NATO allies much greater forcefulness provide trainers. If NATO allies going come combat forces pledged, least could provide additional trainers. Larger Afghan security forces also require mid-level Afghan officers. In addition supporting efforts graduate Afghan officers army academies, consider recommendation Defense Minister Wardak previous mid-level officers fought war Soviets return service interim basis. Minister Wardak emphasized men well qualified well motivated, may trained current tactics, nonetheless could temporarily meet need enlarged army new group officers trained. A larger Afghan force need supporting infrastructure, barracks. While available infrastructure may modern, adequate exists sufficient amounts. Larger Afghan security forces require additional equipment. There must major effort transfer significant amount equipment coming Iraq Afghan army police. Such significant commitment equip Afghan security forces would also help demonstrate U.S. determination take initiative create momentum right direction. There enormous amount equipment coming Iraq; military calling one greatest transfers military goods world's history. A significant part could transferred Afghan forces, increasing capability without weakening readiness. And yet seem kind crash effort place that. We need obtain urgent basis list basic equipment needs Afghan forces list needs could met major program transfer equipment leaving Iraq. Rapidly expanding Afghanistan's military police forces would address one major problems risks face there. General McChrystal told us worries waiting 2013 larger Afghan force creates gap capabilities brings significant risk failure. But accelerating training equipping Afghan forces year, address concern. Depending additional capability Afghan, rather U.S., forces, also addresses major problem public perception Afghanistan. The larger military footprint there, enemies seek drive wedge us Afghan population, spreading falsehood seek dominate Muslim nation. Finally, make concerted effort separate local Taliban leaders. In Iraq, large numbers young Iraqis attacking us switched side became "Sons Iraq." They drawn part promise jobs amnesty past attacks, part recognition status quo creating horrific violence communities. In interests interests nation, switched sides became positive force. That prospect exists Afghanistan. Afghan leaders military say local Taliban fighters motivated largely need job loyalty local leader pays ideology religious zeal. They believe effort attract fighters government's side could succeed, offered security families, penalty previous activity us. General McChrystal emphasized potential re-integration accomplish result achieved Iraq. Here General McChrystal said July 28th: "Most fighters see Afghanistan Afghans, foreign cadre them. But don't see deeply ideological even politically motivated; operating pay; commander's charismatic leadership; frustrated local leaders. So I believe significant potential go I would call mid- low-level Taliban fighters leaders offer re-integration Afghanistan constitution." But "game changing" possibility apparently factored General McChrystal's assessment. There plan yet put place Sons Iraq approach Afghanistan. It urgent lay steps need taken involve local national Afghan leaders effort. They alone accomplish crucial job, first Afghan allies must draft plan urgent basis. And potential positive impact plan taken account consider need additional U.S. military resources. Afghanistan's people grateful aid, also eager assume responsibility future. In tiny village Helmand Province, invited meet village elders council meeting, shura. One hundred men sat floor chatted us future country's future. When asked long United States stay, one elder said: "Until moment make security forces self-sufficient. Then welcome visit us, soldiers guests." Helping Afghanistan achieve self-sufficiency security everybody's goal. On little difference opinion, Afghanistan's village councils corridors Capitol. Can help Afghanistan reach self-sufficiency security fast enough? Can get way regains initiative creates momentum need? Can encourage lower level Taliban abandon insurgency headed terrorists whose fanaticism don't share? I believe can, supporting far rapid growth Afghan Army police; providing trainers quickly; rapid infusion Afghan units equipment longer needed Iraq; rapidly adopting plan re-integration lower level Taliban fighters Afghan society. In words, need surge Afghan security forces. Our support surge show commitment success mission clearly national security interest, without creating bigger U.S. military footprint provides propaganda fodder Taliban. I believe taking steps urgent basis, completing previously planned announced increase U.S. combat forces, provides best chance success mission: preventing Afghanistan run Taliban government harbors supports Al-Qaeda, whose goal inflict additional catastrophic attacks United States world. And implement steps considering increase U.S. ground combat forces beyond already planned end year.

To rebuild Haiti, start young people A 700,000-strong national civic service corps would harness untapped labor rapidly instill national pride confidence. By Robert Muggah Robert Maguire January 31, 2010 Haiti need big ideas recover rebuild aftermath devastating magnitude 7.0 earthquake month. The reported death toll topped 150,000, reconstruction needs incalculable. How starting 700,000-strong national civic service corps made Haitian youth? There many reasons entity makes lot sense. Haiti young country. An estimated 70% population 30; 15-to-29 segment alone makes 50% population. Demographers long cautioned excessively youthful populations potentially exacerbate underdevelopment accentuate political instability. Although Haiti registers among lowest levels education Western Hemisphere, Haitian youth wellspring creativity, talent potential. You don't need community-development specialist know stifled lack meaningful opportunities. Fortunately, Haiti enabling environment set civic service corps. Article 52 Haitian Constitution commits citizens national service, though never activated. What more, many Haitian international organizations mobilized ready help government get going. A civic service corps would get young able tent cities around Port-au-Prince work. They could start once-iconic center capital, also could begin planting trees, working fields providing services Haiti's countryside. At minimum, would reverse generations unfair stigmatizing youth there. This plan would also harness untapped labor rapidly. Before Jan. 12 earthquake, 50% youth 20s work. Putting service toward rebuilding capital outlying areas would first step restoring country's pride dignity. A civic service corps would also multiply international efforts promote recovery world moves next crisis. Hundreds humanitarian agencies, donor governments nongovernmental organizations facing monumental challenges coordinating relief assistance. Although everyone involved committed rapid disbursement, transaction costs monumental. A civic service corps would allow rapid form transferring capital. Direct support corps would inject serious liquidity Haitian economy stimulate recovery bottom up. Rather food-for-work schemes, international best practice recommends proposals promote direct monetary transfers beneficiaries. Haitian youth families urgent needs don't need paternalistic programs curb choices. With proper oversight financial safeguards, civic service corps would circumvent unnecessary administrative costs. Further, civic service corps would restore national pride confidence Haitian public institutions. During past decades, state provided relatively services Haitians, particularly outside capital. In cases, state entities downright predatory. As result, nonstate providers, including gangs shady middlemen, filled gap. A civic service corps -- wearing Haitian colors acting first responders organizations demonstrating government's presence ground -- would show government serious supporting citizens. It would symbolic first step toward renewing social contract people. A civic service corps also makes sense long-term risk emergency planning. Haiti situated path hurricanes fault line, expect disasters. Training 700,000 young people -- especially young women -- basics first aid, emergency response, community policing skills would greatly mitigate consequences future calamities. With disciplined training management, corps could provide intensive training specialized areas -- engineering, telecommunications public health. An initial step getting Haiti's youth work could include preparation road map future meetings Haiti, including U.N. donor conference scheduled March. Any final plan would need draw invaluable experiences ongoing efforts mobilize youth Haiti. These include work Brazilian nongovernmental organization Viva Rio supporters. Before earthquake, Viva Rio Brazilian peacekeepers recruited trained hundreds Haitian youth, including former gang members, provide relief services Haiti's slums. This program could reactivated scaled quickly. A civic service corps could draw lessons groups target recruit youths for, say, two years. The Haitian government would, course, need one manage undertaking, direct oversight president's office Interior Ministry. And many countries could provide advice support. Nongovernmental groups private donors could also play key role mobilizing support transferring essential skills. Haiti's youth future nation, central Haiti's recovery. A civic service corps large-scale way quickly mobilize act catalyst long-term, progressive changes. Robert Muggah, based Graduate Institute International Development Studies Geneva, principal SecDev Group currently advising multilateral bilateral organizations Haiti's recovery. Robert Maguire faculty Trinity Washington University chairs Haiti Working Group United States Institute Peace Washington. Copyright (c) 2010, The Los Angeles Times
