Rajiv Shah From Wikipedia, free encyclopedia Current Under Secretary Rajiv Shah Rajiv "Raj" Shah (born March 9, 1973) presently Under Secretary Agriculture Research, Education, Economics (REE) Chief Scientist United States Department Agriculture. Prior appointment USDA, Shah worked range leadership roles Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation including Director Agricultural Development, Director Financial Services, leader Strategic Opportunities initiative manager Foundation's $1.5 billion commitment Vaccine Fund. He also came idea International Finance Facility Immunization transform global system vaccine financing, worked secure donor commitments $5 billion facility. Before joining Gates Foundation, Shah health care policy advisor Al Gore presidential campaign, 2000 member Governor Ed Rendell's (D-PA) transition committee health. Shah earned M.D. University Pennsylvania School Medicine M.Sc. Health Economics Wharton School University Pennsylvania. He graduate University Michigan also attended London School Economics. President Obama announced Shah's selection Under Secretary Research, Education, Economics Chief Scientist April 17, 2009. Shah's nomination confirmed United States Senate unanimous consent May 12, 2009. Early life family Born Indian immigrant parents settled Ann Arbor, Michigan late 60's, Raj Shah grew Detroit area attended Wylie Groves High School. He lives wife, Shivam, two young children, Sajan Amna. He one sister, Ami Shah, medical doctor. Career Raj Shah currently Under Secretary Research, Education Economics (REE) Chief Scientist U.S. Department Agriculture. The REE mission area provides science federal agencies, policy makers, researchers, others draw meet challenges facing America's food agriculture system. The four REE agencies Agricultural Research Service (including National Agricultural Library), Economic Research Service, National Agricultural Statistics Service, Cooperative State Research, Education Extension Service. Prior appointment USDA Raj worked range leadership roles Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation help poorest people earth lead healthy productive lives. As Director Agricultural Development program, Shah oversaw foundation's multi-billion dollar portfolio grant program-related investments help transform rural economies throughout developing world help small farmers families overcome hunger poverty. He led efforts create Alliancefor Green Revolution Africa, helped recruit leadership including UN Secretary General Kofi Annan, serves Board Directors. He oversaw grant portfolios science technology; farmer productivity; market access; policy, statistics advocacy; managed team 60 professionals. He also developed innovative partnerships private industry, United Nations, World Bank, country governments around world, active voice issues related food hunger. As Foundation's first Director Financial Services Poor portfolio, Shah worked broad range financial institutions donors determine Foundation resources could best amplify field's collective impact. Previously, led Strategic Opportunities initiative worked Foundation co-chairs identify, assess recommend new areas giving. This process led creation Foundation's Global Development Program. Shah's early work Foundation focused global health. As Deputy Director Policy Finance, Raj managed Foundation's $1.5 billion commitment Vaccine Fund — effort referred Bill Melinda Gates best investment. He also came idea International Finance Facility Immunization transform global system vaccine financing worked secure donor commitments $5 billion facility. The World Health Organization estimates initiative save five million children's lives next decade, New York Times article described effort "a clever way reduce burden costly diseases save money future." Shah previously worked health care policy advisor Gore 2000 presidential campaign, active supporter Barack Obama presidential campaign, 2008, served member Pennsylvania Governor Ed Rendell's health transition committee. He also co-founded Health Systems Analytics (a health care consulting firm), served advisor City Philadelphia's Public Health Commissioner, worked World Health Organization. In addition, co-founded multiple nonprofit organizations focused increasing political awareness civic engagement minority communities, including Project Impact South Asian Americans.
Lael Brainard From Wikipedia, free encyclopedia Lad Brainard senior fellow Brookings Institution 2001 2009, served vice president director Global Economy Development program June 2006 March 16, 2009. Brainard nominated President Barack Obama Under Secretary Treasury International Affairs.al Brainard served Deputy National Economic Adviser Chair Deputy Secretaries Committee International Economics Clinton Administration. As Deputy Director National Economic Council, helped build new White House organization address global economic challenges Asian financial crisis China's WTO entry. As US Sherpa G8, helped shape 2000 G8 Development Summit first time included leaders poorest nations laid foundations Global Fund Fight AIDS, TB, Malaria. She mentioned likely U.S. Trade Representative Obama administration. 121 Previously, Brainard served Associate Professor Applied Economics MIT Sloan School Management, publications made important contributions relationship offshore production, trade, jobs; measurement structural cyclical unemployment US economy; strategic trade policy. Brainard also worked McKinsey & Co. advising corporate clients strategic challenges microenterprise West Africa. Brainard alumna George School class 1979, boarding school Newtown, PA. Brainard received masters doctoral degrees Economics Harvard University, National Science Foundation Fellow. She graduated highest honors Wesleyan University degree College Social Studies. She recipient White House Fellowship Council Foreign Relations International Affairs Fellowship, Marshall Scholar elect, member Wesleyan University Board Trustees, Council Foreign Relations, Aspen Strategy Group. Publications Brainard co-editor Too Poor For Peace? (2007); co-editor Offshoring White Collar Work (2006); editor Transforming Development Landscape: Role Private Sector (2006) Security Other Means: Foreign Assistance, Global Poverty American Leadership (2006); coauthor The Other War: Global Poverty Millennium Challenge Corporation (2004). On March 23, 2009 nominated Under-Secretary Treasury International Affairs President Barack Obama. Select recent publications include "Services Offshoring, American Jobs, Global Economy," Robert E. Litan, Perspectives Work (Winter 2005); "Reassessing National Security," Michael O'Hanlon, Alice Rivlin Isabel Sawhill, eds., Restoring Fiscal Sanity (2004); "Building Common Ground Trade Demands More Than Name Change," Hal Shapiro, The George Washington International Law Review, 2003; "Compassionate Conservatism Confronts Global Poverty," The Washington Quarterly, Spring 2003; "The Implications Global Economy America's Campaign Terrorism," Cambridge Review International Affairs, July 2002; "Are U.S. Multinationals Exporting U.S. Jobs?" David Riker, David Greenaway Douglas Nelson, eds., Globalization Labour Markets (Elgar, 2001). Brainard married Kurt Campbell, nominated April assistant secretary state East Asian Pacific affairs.121

Philippe Jake asked send along response Washington Post editorial: By Michael Posner The Post's Dec. 27 editorial ("Redefining Human Rights") Obama Administration's human rights democracy policies, Secretary Clinton's recent speech Georgetown particular, misses critical point: human rights, democracy, development mutually reinforcing, competing goals. They complement task making human rights human reality. President Roosevelt understood fundamental link liberty, prosperity security, tying together freedom speech worship freedom want freedom fear famous "Four Freedoms" speech. At Georgetown, Secretary Clinton articulated 21st century vision grounded wisdom. To accuse Secretary Clinton embracing Soviet-bloc approach human rights includes development discussion democracy strains bonds credulity common sense, also walls crucial avenue ensuring people actually exercise rights naturally - including rights freedom religion, association, speech-in daily lives. As Secretary Clinton made clear, policies address development alone adequate: "Freedom doesn't come half measures, partial remedies solve whole problem," said. But experience shows us broad-based development occurs, people likely demand say securing futures, governments likely resources maintain strong institutions, including reliable police fair courts, help ensure consistent protection rights. Where people given right speak freely, participate nation's political process access basic information government, sustainable development likely occur. At time, democracies without development last. These mutually reinforcing tracks, Obama Administration committed pursuing simultaneously. As President Obama said Nobel lecture, "engagement repressive regimes lacks satisfying purity indignation." But Post's overheated outrage ignores lessons learned generations men women worked advance human rights around world. To suggest Secretary Clinton somehow provided excuses rights-abusing dictators speech forcefully criticized specific abuses across world, simply credible. Far excuse regime, approach pushes governments advance civil political rights ensure democracy actually delivers measure prosperity opportunity all. That right approach Obama Administration 21st century. ###

The New Public Diplomacy Joseph S. Nye 2010-02-10 CAMBRIDGE — The world traditional power politics typically whose military economy would win. In today's information age, politics also whose "story" wins. National narratives are, indeed, type currency. Governments compete organizations enhance credibility weaken opponents. Witness contest government protesters Iranian elections June 2009, Internet Twitter played crucial roles, recent controversy Google China. Reputation always mattered world politics, credibility become crucial "paradox plenty." When information plentiful, scarce resource attention. Under new conditions, soft sell may, ever, prove effective hard sell. For example, relative independence BBC, sometimes source consternation British governments, paid rich dividends credibility, illustrated account Tanzanian President Jakaya Kikwete's day: "he rises dawn, listens BBC World Service, scans Tanzanian press." Skeptics treat term "public diplomacy" mere euphemism propaganda miss point. Simple propaganda counterproductive public diplomacy. Nor public diplomacy merely public-relations campaign. Public diplomacy also involves building long-term relationships create enabling environment government policies. The contribution direct government information long-term cultural relationships varies three dimensions stages public diplomacy, three important. The first immediate dimension daily communications, involves explaining context domestic foreign-policy decisions. This dimension also involves preparation dealing crises. If vacuum information event, others rush fill it. The second dimension strategic communication, develops set simple themes, much political advertising campaign does. While first dimension measured hours days, second occurs weeks, months, even years. The third dimension public diplomacy development lasting relationships key individuals many years even decades, scholarships, exchanges, training, seminars, conferences, access media channels. These programs develop American journalist Edward R. Murrow called crucial "last three feet" — face-to-face communications, enhanced credibility reciprocity creates. But even best advertising cannot sell unpopular product. A communications strategy cannot work cuts grain policy. Actions speak louder words. All often, policymakers treat public diplomacy bandage applied damage done instruments. For example, China tried enhance soft power successfully staging 2008 Olympics, domestic simultaneous crackdown Tibet — subsequent repression Xinxiang arrests human rights lawyers — undercut gains. Great powers try use culture narrative create soft power promotes advantage, always understand it. Critics United States complain over-militarization foreign policy undercuts credibility. Instead, advocate diplomacy "on steroids," staffed diplomats trained new media, cross-cultural communications, granular local knowledge, networks contacts under- represented groups. The centralized mass-media approach public diplomacy still plays important role. Governments need correct daily misrepresentations policies, well try convey longer-term strategic message. The main strength mass-media approach audience reach ability generate public awareness set agenda. But weakness inability influence message perceived different cultural settings. The sender knows says, always targets hear. Cultural barriers apt distort heard. Networked communications, hand, take advantage two-way communications peer-to- peer relations overcome cultural differences. This type decentralization flexibility difficult governments accomplish, given central accountability structures. The greater flexibility non-governmental organizations using networks given rise call "the new public diplomacy," longer confined messaging, promotion campaigns, even direct governmental contacts foreign publics serving foreign-policy purposes. It also building relationships civil-society actors countries facilitating networks non-governmental parties home abroad. In approach public diplomacy, government policy aimed promoting participating in, rather controlling, cross-border networks. Indeed, much government control, even appearance it, undercut credibility networks designed engender. The evolution public diplomacy one-way communications two-way dialogue treats publics co-creators meaning communication. Power global information age, ever, include soft dimension attraction well hard dimensions coercion payment. Combining dimensions effectively called "smart power." For - example, current struggle transnational terrorism struggle winning hearts minds, over-reliance hard power alone path success. Public diplomacy important tool arsenal smart power, smart public diplomacy requires understanding credibility, self-criticism, role civil society generating soft power. If degenerates propaganda, public diplomacy fails convince, undercut soft power. Instead, must remain two-way process, soft power depends, first foremost, upon understanding minds others.

Best, Mike Former aide urges Obama regain 'political narrative' By Edward Luce Washington Published: February 15 2010 Barack Obama, US president, lost control political narrative needs make use cabinet order regain it, says John Podesta, man headed president's transition team. "My friends White House would agree this, lost narrative," Mr Podesta said interview View DC, Financial Times' video series Washington. "Clearly needs one speech while: needs, I think, constantly reinforced. And president, entire team ... He's got terrific cabinet. Use it. Get country use it." Mr Podesta, also chief staff Bill Clinton, drew parallels former president's difficulties first two years, culminated 1994 Republican takeover Congress following failure healthcare reform. When asked whether failure latest attempt healthcare reform would result similar electoral "massacre" Democratic party mid-term elections November, said: "I subscribe view." Mr Podesta founded Centre American Progress, Washington's largest liberal think-tank, often described "government-in-exile" years George W. Bush White House. He said Mr Obama three options healthcare reform. First, try enact whole thing using budget reconciliation process, would enable pass 51 votes. The Democrats lost controlling 60-seat super-majority last month election defeat Massachusetts. The second would pass watered bill Republican support The third would abandon attempt, Mr Clinton 1993. Mr Podesta, Mr Obama still regularly consults, said still better 50:50 chance getting reform through. "The worst option among three nothing, they're going figure track viable," said. "It may mean Democratic votes. But such, it." He painted fairly bleak view overall health US politics. "It sucks," said. Pointing strategy obstructionism Republican lawmakers, said: "I think president trying re-engage Republicans, but, quite frankly, he's dealing party [Abraham] Lincoln. He's dealing party [Sarah] Palin." The growth partisanship increasing difficulty getting big reforms Senate threatening turn US into, "in essence, parliamentary system without majority rule", opposition automatically opposes serious initiatives. The political stasis California provided writing wall US whole, said. Since 1978 passage Proposition 13 state, budget changes required two-thirds majority. "And nothing gets done." Michael H. FYI -- Reid: Shelby Has Hold On All Nominees Friday, Feb. 5, 2010 Sen. Richard Shelby, R-Ala., placed blanket hold executive nominations Senate calendar effort win concessions Obama administration Pentagon variety fronts affecting home state, according aides Senate Majority Leader Reid. Reid spokeswoman Regan Lachapelle said Shelby blocking 70 pending nominations. Reid force vote nomination filing cloture. Because time required vote multiple nominations, Senate processes nominations unanimous consent. Any one senator block nominations objecting unanimous consent request take up. The nominations remain stalled unless Reid files cloture. While holds frequent, Senate aides said blanket hold represents far aggressive use power normal. "He holding 70-plus nominees parochial issue," Democratic aide said. "They're qualified moving forward." Disclosure blanket hold came two days top Democrats voiced mounting frustration Republican holds executive nominees. 'We've got huge backlog folks unanimously viewed well qualified -- nobody specific objection -- end hold completely unrelated piece business," President Obama said Wednesday televised meeting Senate Democrats. On Senate floor Thursday, Reid, Senate Majority Whip Durbin, Senate Judiciary Chairman Patrick Leahy Senate Armed Services Chairman Carl Levin ripped Republicans holds national security nominees judges. Editorial: Mrs. Clinton Pakistan NEW YORK TIMES October 30, 2009 Hillary Rodham Clinton's first trip Pakistan secretary state never going easy. The day arrived, extremists detonated car bomb crowded market Peshawar killed least 100 people. The Nation newspaper dismissed visit mere "PR exercise, buy US selling difficult imagine, beyond already compliant government." Polls show overwhelming majority Pakistanis dislike mistrust United States. They blame Washington using abandoning Soviets driven Afghanistan. And resent Washington pressing government fight extremists — suspect abandoned again. The fact many extremists Pakistan's territory threatening Pakistan's government shifted thinking mitigated resentment. A good part this, course, failure Pakistan's government, still adequately explained America's fight. But United States also blame. For eight years Bush administration coddled Pakistani Army expense rest society. Mrs. Clinton challenged Pakistan's government shut Al Qaeda, was, rightly, determined use visit also broaden relationship. Instead courting President Asif All Zardari army chief, Gen. Ashfaq Parvez Kayani, Mrs. Clinton also held talks top opposition leader, Nawaz Sharif; parried questions audience deeply suspicious college students; met civil society leaders, including women Pashtun elders; gave interviews Pakistani journalists; visited religious cultural sights. She promised refocus American aid "needs people" announced targeted commitments, including $85 million microloans poor women start businesses $125 million first phase electricity project aimed reducing blackouts improving energy conservation. Those grants welcome still small change compared five-year, $7.5 billion — nonmilitary — aid package approved Congress signed law year. That package supposed demonstrate Pakistanis that, time, United States long haul. Instead, become another focus popular resentment. The Army Pakistani news media whipped disingenuous complaints legislation (Islamabad consulted beforehand) compromised Pakistan's sovereignty conditioning disbursement adequate civilian control military. If Washington ever enlist Pakistan reliable ally, going much better job explaining itself. And going insist Pakistan's leaders start explaining real stakes citizens real benefits alliance United States. Mrs. Clinton's trip important start — start.

FYI: Jan 12, 2010 » Mobile Home » Top Stories Inside Reid eruption By Mike Allen & Glenn Thrush I 1/12/10 @ 12:19 AM EST Harry Reid isn't talkative. But Senate majority leader chatted freely two disarmingly charming book authors came office Capitol shortly 2008 election. They — tape recorder — soaking reminiscences wild campaign turned backbencher caucus president United States. Reid wasn't guard — perhaps he'd told staff meeting would "off record," according person knowledge exchange. Although Reid master Senate's mysterious inside game, he's often botched outside game one colleague calls "penchant saying things without filter." But Jim Manley, Reid's senior communications adviser, wasn't worried boss sat John Heilemann New York Magazine Mark Halperin Time magazine — two veteran reporters working publisher billed "a sweeping, novelistic, ultimately definitive portrait" 2008 race. Like virtually every Washington political insider, Manley long warm relationship Halperin, longtime political director ABC News set conventional wisdom Washington "The Note." Maybe Reid Manley — thinking back many candid exchanges years — simply assumed Halperin wouldn't burn boss. Or maybe expected Halperin would check back quotes planned use? Whatever thinking, wrong. Reid talking reasons why, even though publicly professed neutrality vicious Democratic primaries 2008, secretly encouraged then-Illinois Sen. Barack Obama challenge another member caucus, then-New York Sen. Hillary Clinton. And amid talk Obama's oratorical gifts, let slip something else: Obama could win White House "light-skinned" African-American "with Negro dialect, unless wanted one." The authors write "Game Change," published weekend, Reid made remark "privately." They say said them. As chagrined Reid telephoned political allies Senate civil rights community shore support weekend, made clear felt burned authors. In book's"Authors' Note," wrote: "All interviews — junior staffers candidates — conducted 'deep background' basis, means agreed identify subjects sources way. We believed essential eliciting level candor book sort depends." Heilemann said MSNBC's "Morning Joe": "We clear agreement sources interviews would deep background.... Our ground rules ... won't identify sources sources material. But said clearly put scenes book, uttering dialogue people book part scene, would identify utterer words." Halperin added: "There's one talked book burned way, violated agreement with." Manley, Capitol Hill veteran also worked late Sen. Ted Kennedy, responsible monitoring interview dealing issues arising it. But didn't tell anyone else Reid's inner circle inflammatory remarks boss made; good relationship authors, assumed quotes would never made public — least without knowing first. Manley declined comment story-- wouldn't confirm interview took place. On Friday 10 p.m. — half year interview — The Atlantic's Marc Ambinder e-mailed Reid's staff questions "light-skinned" candidate without "Negro dialect." In second-guessing followed, Capitol Hill veterans said way inflammatory words Senate majority leader would remain record, even arrangement. But Manley sounded internal alarm, rest damage-control squad caught flat- footed Ambinder's e-mail, several people close situation told POLITICO. "They could weeks prepare try convince Halperin run it," said Democrat participated damage control. Now staff blindsided revelation that, mishandled, could politically fatal. Manley aides worked 2 a.m. Saturday draft Reid's carefully written apology, emphasized record African- American issues. "I deeply regret using poor choice words," 90-word statement began. Later Saturday, Manley helped lead counteroffensive, calling White House press secretary Robert Gibbs, friend days communications director Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee, set apology call Reid, home Searchlight, Nev., Obama back Washington. In stunning "Statement President" e-mailed reporters 3:55 p.m. Saturday, Obama said: "Harry Reid called today apologized unfortunate comment reported today.... As far I'm concerned, book closed." Relieved president's solid backing, Reid's aides decided toughest challenge would prevent prominent African-American Democrats attacking Reid harshly — calling resignation. Reid's team correctly anticipated Republicans would demand head. Keeping criticism becoming bipartisan drumbeat key. The team calculated long attacks looked like partisan shouting, Reid would benefit. Aides say boss quickly understood danger spent much Saturday working call list 30 prominent African-Americans across country. On calls, apologized words argued book's main takeaway quietly supported Obama Clinton, long made feelings public. Among called Rev. Al Sharpton; longtime civil rights leader Julian Bond; Rep. Barbara Lee (D-Calif.), chairwoman Congressional Black Caucus; political consultant talk-show fixture Donna Brazile; House Majority Whip Jim Clyburn (D-S.C.); Wade Henderson, CEO Leadership Conference Civil Rights; Hilary Shelton, director NAACP's Washington office. The extent damage already shaky reelection chances Nevada won't known November. But Monday, Reid believed Washington storm passing. From home New York, Sen. Chuck Schumer telephoned Reid Nevada offered organize letter support Democratic senators. Reid decided unnecessary. He confidently concluded now, least, won inside game.

FYI — POLITICO Boehner chief staff dies 46 By: Patrick O'Connor January 10, 2010 01:40 PM EST Paula Nowakowski, longtime chief staff House Republican Leader John Boehner, died unexpectedly Saturday night, according leader's office. She 46. "It profound sadness shock I announce passing Paula Nowakowski, longtime chief staff, trusted aide friend, died suddenly last night," Boehner said statement early Sunday afternoon. "Words cannot adequately express sorrow disbelief I every member team grappling today wake stunning news." A Boehner aide said cause apparent heart attack. President Barack Obama Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-Calif.) among called Boehner Sunday offer condolences Nowakoski's death. "The entire Capitol Hill community shocked saddened sudden passing Paula Nowakowski," Pelosi said statement. "As Chief Staff Republican Leader John Boehner, Paula earned respect Leadership Conference, House Members sides aisle. She served Leader Boehner current position well previously Committee Education Workforce great distinction. "Paula thorough professional loved House worked constructive bipartisan fashion implement policies help Congress function efficiently. On behalf entire House, I express deep sadness Paula's family, friends colleague, Leader John Boehner." "Paula finest qualities public servant have: committed advancing cause freedom, cared deeply people served, patriot," said Minority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY.). "On behalf senate colleagues, I pass condolences family, Leader Boehner staff, whole House family tragic loss friend." It would hard overstate Nowakowski's role Boehner's tight-knit office. She worked Ohio Republican almost continuously since 1995, joined staff communications director Republican Conference. In years since, worked staff director Education Labor Committee served chief staff since returned leadership early 2006. She briefly left Boehner's side 1998 lost conference post following tough election Republicans rejoined 2001 assumed chairmanship Education Labor Committee. Along way, counseled Boehner every decision made often served enforcer sorts collegial Republican leader. It would hard find chief staff Capitol Hill maintained closer relationship boss one shared Boehner. Aides said Sunday Boehner's office extended network former colleagues, known many "Boehner-land," collectively shocked news. "We remember Paula would want remembered — tireless worker, faithful friend, rabid Detroit sports fan, whip-smart strategist, warrior freedom devoted Catholic counted President Ronald Reagan Pope John Paul II among greatest heroes. She never replaced forgotten," Boehner said. "I ask prayers Paula's family." ©2009Capitol News Company, LLC FD HIDDEN DIV Tmt Washington ost NEWS! POLITICS I OPINIONS! Boehner's chief staff, dies 46 By Martin Weil Washington Post Staff Writer Monday, January 11, 2010; B04 Paula Nowakowski, 46, chief staff House Minority Leader John A. Boehner, found dead Jan. 10 home Alexandria. No official cause death available. Antonia Ferrier, spokeswoman Boehner (R-Ohio), said appeared Ms. Nowakowski died heart attack. A longtime Hill aide, Boehner's staff chief since 2006, Ms. Nowakowski named Capitol Hill publication Roll Call 2009 list "Fabulous Fifty" staff members. The accolade recognized savvy, clout access top people Congress. Ms. Nowakowski, avowed conservative, highly regarded leaders parties. She praised Boehner House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-Calif.). "It profound sadness shock I announce passing Paula Nowakowski, longtime chief staff, trusted aide, friend, died suddenly," Boehner said statement. "Words cannot adequately express sorrow disbelief I every member team grappling today wake stunning news," Boehner said. Pelosi called Ms. Nowakowski "thorough professional loved House worked constructive bipartisan fashion implement policies help Congress function efficiently." According WhoRunsGov. corn, Washington Post Co. Web site, Ms. Nowakowski grew St. Clair Shores, Mich., studied English Cornell University Ithaca, N.Y. She told Politico made conservative campus "rise loony left," citing "wacky, wacky stuff," shaped politics. According reference book congressional aides, worked Republican National Committee late 1980s early 1990s, joined staff House Republican Conference. After two years public affairs vice president American Insurance Association, worked 2001 2006 staff director House Committee Education & Workforce. A Boehner aide said worked Republican Conference Education Committee. Pelosi's staff chief, John Lawrence, Ms. Nowakowski's Democratic counterpart education committee, said transcended political differences "work collegial way strengthen House itself." He called "a great professional." After GOP lost House majority 2006 , Ms. Nowakowski said experienced "the seven stages grief," according Almanac Unelected 2008, reference Hill staffers. "You don't want compliant minority," said party's new status, "but adjust expectations." In statement, Boehner called Ms. Nowakowski "a tireless worker, faithful friend rabid Detroit sports fan. PIR <preines( Wednesday, March 17, 2010 12:59 AM Huma Abedin Steinberg Project: First (Baby) Step http://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2010/03/when-a-schedule-is-more-than-a-schedule/37587/ When A Schedule Is More Than A Schedule By Marc Am binder The Atlantic.com Mar 16 2010, 9:45 PM ET Close observers State Department noticed something different afternoon: daily schedule distributed department includes, first time, information Deputy Secretary State Jim Steinberg's appointments. Until recently, daily release included Secretary State Hillary Clinton's schedule only. No longer. "Steinberg meet Wednesday Singaporean Deputy Prime Minister Teo Chee Hean." The inclusion Steinberg suggests department aware needs better job integrating Steinberg's portfolio general communications strategy show leadership department acts concert. "Jim always integral part Secretary's team, haven't always shown crucial State's mission," said Philippe Reines, Clinton's communications consiglieri. "This one simple way fix that." The Beltway rumor mill often includes gossip Steinberg isn't happy, he's seen integral part President Obama's foreign policy team, efforts aren't appreciated. Reines, rarely speaks record, responded question whether Steinberg indeed unhappy way: "I'm shrink, I confess don't sit around circle often enough exploring feelings. But crystal clear everyone Jim smart, dedicated, valued." Steinberg principal adviser issues ranging Iran -- administration's team lead, cybersecurity China (he's tasked pressuring China accepting tougher sanctions Iran), work often goes unnoticed. Jim Jones National Security Adviser, asked Clinton make Steinberg deputy -- did. Since day one, prognosticators predicting friction Steinberg Clinton, although none publicly surfaced.

See piece defamation religion. Not bad. http: I /www.economist.com/world/international/displavstorv.cfm?story id=15833005 Religion human rights The limits freedom faith Mar 31st 2010 From The Economist print edition Opponents bid Muslim states "protect religion" claim small success How dare call us blasphemers? IT DOES happen often: Christian lobbyists, sort favour prayer American classrooms crucifixes Italian ones, lining side secularists battle curb religion's role public square. But camps quiet satisfaction recent vote United Nations. Not outcome, slim margin defeat. On March 25th Human Rights Council (HRC), Geneva-based UN agency often exasperates Western members, voted 20 votes 17, eight abstentions, text lists "defamation religion" infringement liberty. Nothing amazing there: Organisation Islamic Conference (OIC), groups 56 mainly Muslim states (plus Palestine), working push resolutions kind General Assembly UN bodies since 2005. But margin smallest ever, opponents think could good chance defeating "defamation" motion next time one comes around. The OIC's idea establish principle faiths need protection, individuals do. It denies sinister intention (see article). And ears, OIC's effort sounds like harmless UN-speak, nothing more. (The United States Commission International Religious Freedom, congressionally mandated body, noted logical flaw: defamation means harming reputation living person entity: implies one can't defame idea religious founder longer, least physically, alive earth.) But critics OIC campaign, include atheists, Christians indeed Muslims, say "defamation" idea worse hot air: far protecting human rights, emboldens countries use blasphemy laws criminalise dissent. What encourages critics countries seem coming around view. Mexico, Uruguay, Argentina, Zambia South Korea voted latest resolution. Brazil criticised text abstained. Deeper still inside UN's bureaucracy, another battle religion rages—and stakes could even higher. An "ad hoc committee" mulling ways amend extend UN convention racial discrimination. Certain states want language would fuse categories race faith; want new convention, protocol existing one. For secularists (in broad sense people, including believers, oppose idea faith privileged access power), alarming. Non-binding resolutions defamation bad enough; UN treaty race-plus-religion would legal force, least signatories, give heart theocrats. At HRC's latest discussion effort March, Algerian oversees project keen plough ahead. But countries like Switzerland, Japan, Mexico, Argentina France retorted would better enforce existing UN norms dream new ones. Efforts widen racism accord resume, new chairman, late year—but critics relieved stalled it. Still, would-be theocrats may focus harder adding racism charter, face real risk defeated defamation, view Roy Brown, Geneva spokesman International Humanist Ethical Union. Meanwhile Christian-inspired NGO, European Centre Law Justice, denouncing abuse blasphemy laws many OIC member states. How fair point? It easy case make, example, Pakistan. Some 41 complaints blasphemy registered police Pakistan last year, says country's independent Human Rights Commission. In theory, blasphemy punishable death—a penalty handed never carried out. Worst-hit law minorities like Christians Ahmadis, group whose claim Muslim rejected Pakistani state. Although abuse law less rife 1980s, Islamist general tightened rules, law still invoked disputes (over property, say) nothing faith. "The vulnerable people, religious minorities, continue charged blasphemy," said Ali Dayan Hasan, researcher Human Rights Watch, campaign group. "But people convicted? No. Rarely. It used instrument political social coercion." When convictions occur, lead long jail terms; pre-trial detention last years. Pakistan's parliament revising constitution left intact religious bits, despite vow ruling party review blasphemy laws. (Indonesia stepped back move liberalise blasphemy regime.) On Pakistani streets, law dire effects. In January 2009, village Punjab province, five Ahmadis, labourer four children, charged blasphemy. They supposedly written "Prophet Muhammad" wall mosque toilet. The children behind bars nearly six months till charge quashed. And last September young Pakistani Christian accused throwing part Koran drain. It seems real crime, however, affection Muslim woman. A mob torched church, many Christians flee. He taken jail, died days later. His family alleged torture; authorities claimed suicide. There mayhem funeral country's Christians (see picture) appalled. In places, "defamation" faith threatens rights measures supposedly defend it.

Gates warned secret three-page memorandum top White House officials United States effective long-range policy dealing Iran's steady progress toward nuclear capability, according government officials familiar document. Several officials said highly classified analysis, written January President Obama's national security adviser, Gen. James L. Jones, touched intense effort inside Pentagon, White House intelligence agencies develop new options Mr. Obama. They include revised set military alternatives, still development, considered diplomacy sanctions fail force Iran change course. Officials familiar memo's contents would describe portions dealing strategy policy, sections apparently dealt secret operations Iran, deal Persian Gulf allies. The fact don't announce publicly entire strategy world see doesn't mean don't strategy anticipates full range contingencies - do." But memo, Mr. Gates wrote variety concerns, including absence effective strategy Iran choose course many government outside analysts consider likely: Iran could assemble major parts needs nuclear weapon - fuel, designs detonators - stop short assembling fully operational weapon. Mr. Gates never mentioned memo public. Pressed administration's ambiguous phrases close United States willing allow. Iran's program proceed, senior administration official described last week somewhat clearer terms line Iran would permitted cross. The official said United States would ensure Iran would "acquire nuclear capability," step Tehran could get well developed sophisticated weapon. "That includes ability breakout," said, using term nuclear specialists apply country suddenly renounces nonproliferation treaty uses technology build small arsenal. Nearly two weeks ago, Mr. Obama, interview The New York Times, asked whether saw difference nuclear-capable Iran one fully developed weapon. "I'm going parse right now," said. But noted North Korea considered nuclear-capable state threw inspectors and, said, "became self-professed nuclear state." Mr. Gates alluded concern intelligence agencies might miss signals Iran taking final steps toward producing weapon. Last Sunday NBC News program "Meet Press," said: "If policy go threshold assemble nuclear weapon, tell assembled? I don't actually know would verify that." But cautioned Iran run production difficulties, said, "It's going slow - slower anticipated, moving direction." Mr. Gates taken crucial role formulating administration's strategy, known career issue stark warnings possibility strategic surprise. Some officials said memo viewed light: warning relatively new president United States adequately prepared. He wrote memo Iran let pass 2009 deadline set Mr. Obama respond offers diplomatic engagement. Both process efforts bring new sanctions Iran struggled. The next three months spent proved fruitless diplomatic talks Iran plan swap much low-enriched uranium fuel medical reactor Tehran. By time Mr. Gates wrote memo, negotiations collapsed. In fact, Mr. Gates issued warning, chairman Joint Chiefs Staff, Adm. Mike Mullen, wrote official "chairman's guidance" staff saying military option would "limited results" Iran's nuclear facilities, preparations needed stepped up. FYI Kristof's OpEd From Today's NY Times. April 22, 2010 Op-Ed Columnist Obama Backs Down Sudan By NICHOLAS D. KRISTOF JUBA, Sudan Until reached White House, Barack Obama repeatedly insisted United States apply pressure Sudan avoid humanitarian catastrophe Darfur elsewhere. Yet, president, Mr. Obama aides caved, leaving Sudan gloating American weakness. Western monitors, Sudanese journalists local civil society groups found month's Sudanese elections deeply flawed - yet Mr. Obama's special envoy Sudan, Maj. Gen. Scott Gration, pre-emptively defended elections, saying would "as free fair possible." The White House showed hint backbone hurried reference week "an essential step" "serious irregularities." President Omar Hassan al-Bashir Sudan - man wanted International Criminal Court crimes humanity Darfur - celebrating. His regime calls National Congress Party, N.C.P., quoted Sudan telling rally Blue Nile region: "Even America becoming N.C.P. member. No one will." Memo Mr. Obama: When man charged crimes humanity tells world America pocket, it's time review policy. Perhaps Obama administration caved considers flawed election better election. That's reasonable view, one I share. It's conceivable Mr. Bashir could won quasi-fair election - oil revenues manifestly raised standard living parts Sudan - campaigning create space sharp criticism government. It's also true Sudan behaving better respects. The death toll Darfur hugely reduced, government negotiating rebel groups there. The Sudanese government gave visa travel permits Darfur, allowing travel legally freely. The real game isn't, fact, Darfur elections maneuvering possible new civil war. The last north-south civil war Sudan ended fragile peace 2005, two million deaths. The peace agreement provided referendum, scheduled take place January, southern Sudanese decide whether secede. They expected vote overwhelmingly form separate country. Then question becomes: north allow South Sudan separate? The south holds great majority country's oil, it's difficult see President Bashir allowing oil fields walk away. "If result referendum independence, going war - complete war," predicts Mudawi Ibrahim Adam, one Sudan's outspoken human rights advocates. He cautions America's willingness turn blind eye election-rigging increases risk Mr. Bashir feel get away war. "They're naïve Washington," Mr. Mudawi said. "They don't understand going on." On hand, senior Sudanese government official, Ghazi Salahuddin, told unequivocally Khartoum, nation's capital, Sudan honor referendum results. And it's certainly plausible north south muddle avoid war, sides exhausted years fighting. Here Juba, South Sudan capital, I met Winnie Wol, 26, fled civil war 1994 militia north attacked village kill, loot, rape burn. Her father many relatives killed, escaped made way Kenya - eventually resettled refugee California. She lives Olathe, Kan., returned first time Sudan visit mother sisters last seen little girl. Ms. Wol, every bit well-dressed American, let tag along journey back village Nyamlell, 400 miles northwest Juba. The trip ended thatch-roof hut belonged mother, didn't know coming - one home. Ms. Wol crushed. Then scream woman came running. It Ms. Wol's mother, somehow recognizing her, flew other's arms. To me, felt like peace dividend. Yet peace fragile, Ms. Wol knows northern forces may come back pillage again. "I don't want war," said, "but I don't think allow us separate." My hunch north hasn't entirely decided do, strong international pressure reduce risk another savage war. If President Obama ever going find voice Sudan, better soon.

Below article I mentioned: U.S. Revises Tack Mideast Arms Washington, Egypt Discuss Plan Rid Region Nuclear Weapons, Effort Steal Iran's Thunder U.N. Conference By JONATHAN WEISMAN, JAY SOLOMON JOE LAURIA The U.S. negotiating Egypt proposal make Middle East region free nuclear weapons, U.S. seeks prevent Iran derailing monthlong U.N. conference nuclear nonproliferation begins Monday. U.S. officials familiar move call important step assuring countries Washington—criticized silence Israel's undeclared nuclear arsenal—will equitably address weapons proliferation across region, Iran seeks shift focus away nuclear program. Washington also reassured Israel won't foist nuclear-free zone region parties agree significant progress made Mideast peace. The U.N. conference Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty, held every five years, expected begin bang Monday address Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, condemned West refusal disarm tacitly accepting Israel's nuclear capability. Secretary State Hillary Clinton follow Iranian leader afternoon. The U.N. talks come time Iran believed heading toward nuclear capability U.S. allies pressing new, tough Security Council sanctions curb Tehran's program. "The Iranians clearly intending spoil party," said senior U.S. official involved nuclear diplomacy. The official highlighted importance raising Mideast nuclear-free zone issues. The designation region zone free weapons mass destruction nonbinding agreement emerged 1995 U.N. review Non-Proliferation Treaty, 1970 pact limit spread nuclear weapons. That 1995 agreement pivotal won indefinite extension treaty, action zone taken since. Senior Obama administration officials said Friday White House willing significantly advance Mideast nuclear weapons-free zone, would support conference subject future date. U.S. officials said talks Egypt would resume New York coming month. Such zone envisaged include Israel, Arab states, Iran Turkey. "We've made proposal [Egypt] goes beyond U.S. willing before," said senior U.S. official involved nuclear diplomacy. U.S. officials stressed, however, didn't believe would happen without first achieving major advances Arab-Israeli peace talks. "We concerned conditions right unless members region participate, would unlikely unless comprehensive peace plan accepted," said Ellen Tauscher, undersecretary state arms control international security. She said U.S. also discussed zone Arab League members Nonaligned Movement. The diplomacy could raise new tensions President Barack Obama Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu Washington seen backing away commitment Israel. Israel voiced concerns U.N. conference could turn international forum corner Israel. Mr. Netanyahu backed nuclear-security conference Washington March due concerns. An Israeli official said Friday government supports Middle East freeze WMD nuclear weapons, "it culmination process begins bilateral individual peace agreements countries region." The U.S. Israel locked monthslong spat Mr. Obama's calls complete freeze building new Jewish housing West Bank East Jerusalem. U.S. officials grown increasingly confident recent days ties U.S. Israel stabilized. Mrs. Clinton said Friday Mideast peace process get track next week, though U.S.-brokered direct talks involving Israeli Palestinians Obama administration wants see. Egypt's latest proposal calls Israel's disarmament "as soon possible." It also called Israel's nuclear program placed auspices International Atomic Energy Agency, U.N.'s atomic watchdog. That proposal won't accepted, U.S. officials said. The Egyptian working paper demands NPT signatory states release "all information available nature scope Israeli nuclear facilities activities, including information pertaining previous nuclear transfers Israel." U.S. officials indicated demands could made Israel. Arms-control analysts familiar talks say U.S. likely propose creating U.N. envoy given task calling conference Middle East nations press forward nuclear weapon-free zone. "They desperate buy Egyptian objections," said Henry Sokolski, executive director Non-Proliferation Education Center critic Obama administration's arms-control approach. Daryl Kimball, executive director Arms Control Association, advocacy group, said U.S. acceptance special envoy significant shift. A U.S. official refused say whether envoy proposal, first floated Russia, part U.S. offer. The last NPT conference 2005 ended collapse. But U.S. officials said laying groundwork conference nearly year. The White House wants rules ensure country withdraws treaty doesn't escape inspections sanctions. They also want power U.N. inspectors backing multinational facilities could help nations develop peaceful nuclear power. FYI http://thecable.foreignpolicy.com/posts/2010/03/10/lugar money development banks reform Lugar: No money development banks reform Posted By Josh Rogin Wednesday, March 10, 2010 In wake global financial crisis, slew multinational development banks asking large amounts new capital replenish cases expand resource pools, much burden fall United States. This creates unique opportunity Obama administration press organizations implement long-awaited reforms, according Senate's top Republican foreign relations, big say whether Congress doles funds. "As world struggles emerge worst economic crisis since World War II, appropriate time ask whether [International Financial Institutions] performing optimally jobs doing," reads newly released report staff Sen. Richard Lugar, R-IN, "The crisis used excuse win increases could otherwise justified. As requests capital negotiated international donor community, window opportunity significant reform." The report, culmination six years research, including half dozen hearings Lugar committee chairman, outlines several dozen recommendations Obama administration, Congress, banks update relevance. "Does world really need IMF, World Bank, African Development Bank, Asian Development Bank, European Bank Reconstruction Development, Inter-American Development Bank today? Can changed better address needs? How re-design them?" report asks. "Such questions particularly timely nearly IFIs sought, soon seek, major new infusions money donors, including taxpayers United States." The Asian Development Bank already asked Obama administration new funds, administration requested new budget $533 million direct money $12.8 billion borrowing authority ADB. A committee staffer told The Cable Lugar wants see progress reform would support authorizing money. "We want make sure American taxpayer puts money things fixed," staffer said. "It's possible everything, could certainly make progress." The reforms administration could press short term include pressing banks focus development goals rather structure size loans "work donor countries step back slow process," staffer said. Congress also concerned Obama administration might interested pressing reforms, considering Obama issued signing statement June indicating feel bound follow congressional direction international negotiations. Negotiations several banks Treasury Department ongoing. The U.S. side led Scott Morris, deputy assistant secretary Treasury's Office International Development Finance Debt. The issue next surface end March Inter-American Development Bank convenes annual meeting Cancun. Michael H. Fuchs U.S. Department State (202) 647-1709

Media highlighted reports U.S. Pakistan sought "wide-ranging, long term substantive partnership," "established policy steering group talks strategic issues." The signing letter intent U.S. Pakistan help reconstruction priority roads Malakand division also received prominent display. Secretary Defense Gates' meeting Pakistani counterpart, comments "U.S. wants increase military funding Pakistan" received coverage. Pak Army Chief General Kayani's remarks "military willing forgo requests hardware ensure Pakistan's energy economic needs met" also reported. Reports GOP opposition page regarding talks U.S. received front-page display. The civilian nuclear deal issue made news "The News," reported "FO seeks hide unease nuclear snub" "The Nation," reported front-page "U.S. affirms durable partnership civilian N-deal." However Foreign Office spokesman's remarks, "government optimistic positive outcome" also reported. Terming U.S. commitment $125 million power sector, "crucial," "The News," noted editorial "it needs translated action urgently." Its sister mass- circulated Urdu daily, "Jang," however noted word caution, "we think present U.S. overtures woo Pakistan completely altruistic. It remains seen Washington wants Islamabad." Fourteen MPs skipped vote. Same-sex couples able marry starting June 27. The registered-partnership apparatus gay couples used past longer available. The national LGBT association, Samtokin 78, said Iceland removed last obstacle equal rights all. Iceland ninth nation same-sex couples marry nationwide 11th nation same-sex marriage possible. We urge parties Sudan work urgently ensure elections proceed peacefully credibly April. We deeply concerned reports continued administrative logistical challenges, well restrictions political freedoms. FYI: SENSITIVE BUT UNCLASSIFIED January 22, 2010 NOTE FOR THE SECRETARY FROM: G/TIP — Luis CdeBaca SUBJECT: Child Trafficking Haiti G/TIP gravely concerned potential human trafficking (TIP) wake earthquake, result displacement population influx troops aid workers. Even earthquake, Haiti 300,000 restaveks (children given away sold parents enslaved domestic servants), well reports members MINUSTAH used trafficked women prostitution. In 2009 TIP Report Haiti classified Special Case country governance dysfunctional could ranked. The initial disaster response focusing immediate needs food, shelter, medical care, thus far addressed TIP prevention protection issues. While attention paid problems orphans adoptees, TIP adequately addressed UN's initial flash appeal, unclear agency international system lead ground. UNICEF child protection lead, UNFPA leads prevention sexual gender-based violence, IOM tasked shelter camp management. We work remedy, subsequent appeal, omission TIP operational plan. We moving redirect $1 million program funds G/TIP Hispaniola reprogram additional $550,000; work PRM identify funding possibilities. Working existing grantees experienced NG0s, intention help resuscitate police child protection brigades already exist Haiti, rebuild capacity Haitian organizations protect restaveks, prevent traffickers Dominican Republic enslaving displaced Haitians farms prostitution, educate Haitian parents risks giving children away time crisis. We consult partner agencies ensure U.S. presence contribute trafficking. It important Department's messaging convey commitment fighting human trafficking immediate long term. FYI: From one folks hired working Pierre Louis: Lessons Aceh Nias Multi-Donor Trust Fund 1. The Government Indonesia (G01) responded Tsunami issuing series government decrees, immediately organized overview relief efforts ensure rational coordinated response. The first task produce Damage Loss Assessment (DLA). The DLA followed detailed Master Plan Rehabilitation Reconstruction (MPRR). The MPRR provided in-depth sector plans, spatial planning, governance supervision arrangements finances considerable attention avoid minimize corruption. The process behind MPRR consultative, wide range local stakeholders public offices heard. The MPRR presented 26 March, 3 months Tsunami. 2. The MPRR form basis general three-stage strategy. The Relief phase originally set six months, reduced three: January- March 2005. The Rehabilitation phase run 21 months, December 2006, Reconstruction phase July 2006 December 2009. The MPRR provides well defined phasing interventions. 3. The objectives Relief efforts humanitarian relief: rescue; food medicine; emergency infrastructure temporary shelter; burying dead. The Rehabilitation phase restore services minimum level: public services; economic facilities; banking financial institutions; trauma treatments; secure land rights; law order; temporary shelter. Finally, Reconstruction rebuild region: rebuilding economy (production, trade banking); transportation, telecommunications, social cultural systems; improving institutional capacity; housing. 4. The Government set ministerial-level agency manage MPRR program Aceh itself, Rehabilitation Reconstruction Agency Aceh Nias. The BRR formally established end April 2005 became operational early May. The World Bank Board 30 March 2005 formally established Multi-Donor Trust Fund (MDF) Steering Committee comprised BRR, GOI, donors civil society. Having credible local coordinators key success. 5. The EC channels nearly 93% funds MDF, 2.5% USD 400 million US goes MDF. While payments fund slow, disbursements begin even slower. By October 2005, project agreements USD 200 million signed, USD 3 million actually disbursed. Disbursements picked pace thereafter. The delay caused two principal impediments: first, donors quick pledge funds, getting exact written agreements place took time. This points need donors flexible regarding formal agreements, accept simple, generic paragraphs contribute speedy resolution slightly differing phrasings concerns. Second, processing time project approval implementation concern. Since MDF funded projects on-budget, implemented government institutions. This crated bottlenecks. 6. Smaller donors joined wished support reconstruction efforts Aceh capacity often strong views best pursue this. They want Bank assume fiduciary responsibilities funds high-risk environment, also take lead ensuring funds go prioritized activities. The MDF thus seen well-managed bank account paid- administrative services. However, all-inclusive Steering Committee made membership large extent unwieldy, forced discuss policy operational issues. 7. The Multi Donor Fund Secretariat developed Outreach Strategy includes regular radio talk shows, field visits meet discuss beneficiaries communication advertisements well telephone hotline. 8. MDF received praise engaging Government Indonesia (G01) policy dialogue. The MDF thus entry point engaging conditions sustainability, relevance impact. 9. Because MDF accept strict ear marking donor contributions — though allow preference indications — means funds freely available programming according criteria priorities MDF agrees to. Given strong GOI participation, MDF seen successful instrument harmonization coordination environment criticized lack coordination. The MDF's Mid Term Review conducted 2008-2009 found MDF made positive contribution harmonizing donor efforts increasing effectiveness efficiency reconstruction effort. 10. The MDF sufficiently engage private sector coherent job creation strategy. The MDF lacked executive rights, GOI BRR credited leveraging decisive response.

FYI: USIBC Launches New Education Initiative Strengthen K-12, Vocational, Higher Education Linkages U.S. India June 2, 2010 - Washington, DC - On occasion 35th anniversary, looking ahead global economy future, U.S.-India Business Council (USIBC) today announced launch new initiative aimed strengthening institutional linkages academia, industry NGOs focusing elementary, vocational higher education sectors countries. "The United States India must committed partners building workforce tomorrow, partnership unleash opportunity, spur growth sustain prosperity countries across global community," said Harold McGraw III, incoming USIBC Chairman Chairman, President CEO The McGraw-Hill Companies. "To this, must focus strengthening educational ties every level. By working together two countries equip next generation education skills necessary compete win global economy." Mr. McGraw gave keynote address packed audience 400 U.S. Indian business, government, education leaders USIBC's 35th Anniversary Summit, entitled "A Pivotal Period U.S.-India Relations: Tackling Education, Infrastructure Inclusive Growth." On eve first-ever U.S.-India Strategic Dialogue, India's Union Minister External Affairs, SM Krishna, U.S. Education Secretary Arne Duncan, India's Minister Human Resource Development, Kapil Sibal, India's Ambassador United States, Meera Shankar, joined hundreds top business leaders Washington participate U.S.- India Business Council 35th anniversary deliberations. USIBC's Education Initiative serve dynamic platform business, NGOs, academia provide vital input U.S. Indian governments - synergies American Indian business educational communities unleashed. "We talk strategic, defense, civil nuclear, renewable energy every type commercial cooperation, develop skill sets respective societies sustain collaboration, talk never successfully converted action," Ron Somers, President U.S.-India Business Council, noted. "How fortunate families across walks life societies highly value education. We much learn one another, much accomplish - prepare challenges 21st Century," Somers said. The USIBC Education initiative focus three thrust areas: 1. Higher Education: USIBC host U.S.-India Higher Education Forum (HEF) invitation U.S. Indian governments. The HEF serve premier platform enlist academia, industry NGOs strengthen linkages U.S. Indian educational institutions countries. The HEF provide formalized network industry, academia NGO community provide direct policy input U.S. Indian governments areas education, aim facilitate greater collaboration, including opening India's higher education sector. 2. Elementary K-12 Education : USIBC embarked survey rural urban, private public K-12 schools throughout India identify best practices working well educating students, assessing needs industry, NGOs government may join together fill gaps. With support Ryan International Group, one India's leading educators, financial intellectual resources mobilized transform schools manner promotes replication successful models across India. 3. Vocational Training Skills Development : USIBC partner member-companies feature Case Studies Vocational Training Skills Development implemented across India. The exercise attempt enlist corporations participate important area human capacity building. Programs helping train thousands workers generate employment opportunities sustain economic growth long future - countries. India embarked expanding community college system, including technical training institutions, well inviting interest implementing 30,000 new colleges 1,500 universities next decade. The United States continues sought destination Indian students studying overseas, attracting many 113,000 year American universities colleges. The U.S. wishes remain magnet attracting best brightest around world promoting institutional partnerships U.S. based educational institutions new counterparts. Integral core knowledge infrastructure, industry must involved enterprise. The McGraw-Hill Companies (NYSE: MHP) global information education company providing knowledge, insights analysis financial, education business information sectors leading brands including Standard & Poor's, McGraw-Hill Education, J.D. Power Associates Platts. McGraw-Hill established business operations India 40 years ago. Through partnership CRISIL, India's leading ratings, research, risk policy advisory company, Standard & Poor's helping facilitate access capital drive economic growth job creation country. Through partnership Tata, McGraw-Hill Education delivering innovative, digital solutions help workers acquire 21st century skills need succeed today's global economy. India home McGraw-Hill's largest employee population outside U.S. company's fourth largest market. The U.S.-India Business Council, formed 1975 request Government India U.S. Government advance commercial ties world's two largest free-market democracies, hosted aegis U.S. Chamber Commerce. The U.S. Chamber Commerce world's largest business federation representing 3 million businesses organizations every size, sector, region. The U.S.-India Business Council celebrates 35th Anniversary U.S. Chamber Commerce June 2, 2010 Washington, D.C. For information please visit www.usibc.com . www.usibc.com

Tymoshenko, silent publicly, plans bring cases alleged electoral fraud courts, change result. Tymoshenko claims intends work within law incite street protests. FYI: Brazilian FM defends dialogue Iran BRASILIA, Feb. 9 (Xinhua) -- Brazilian Foreign Minister Celso Amorim said Tuesday Brazil would maintain negotiations Iran uranium enrichment oppose sanctions Iran. Amorim said Brazil production nuclear weapons, Iran right carry peaceful nuclear program. "Dialogue still possible. What want make sure (that uranium used make weapons) peaceful ways dialogue," Amorim told reporters. Under draft deal brokered International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), UN nuclear watchdog, Iran's existing low-grade enriched uranium shipped Russia France, would processed fuel rods purity 20 percent. Iran declared Tuesday started process producing 20-percent enriched uranium inside country. In response Iran's announcement, U.S.-led Western countries warned take political economic sanctions Iran. For part, Amorim said considered kind sanctions ineffective dangerous might cross limit jeopardize peace. Iran's president made official visit Brazil November, Brazilian government defended Iran's right peaceful nuclear program including uranium enrichment similar Brazil's, following international standards.

Our clips service doesn't license necessary provide FT (or Reuters) content, here's long awaited FT profile -you'll especially interested guest column David Milliband wrote: An FT interview Hillary Clinton By Daniel Dombey FT June 11 2010 22:21 This like Hillary Clinton. The motorcade, twisting skidding rain-splashed streets hour; public meetings camera lights journey's end; spotlight let two decades. It almost 2008 US presidential election - hailed exciting generation - never ended. But campaign without vote. Today, Clinton's convoy snaking Sao Paulo, Brazil, South Hampton, New Hampshire. She longer aspirant White House, despite overnight flights, town hall meetings strategy sessions make gruelling schedule might suggest. Instead, Latin America shore relations region promote new idea US leadership, one much built around herself. She's bigger ecstatic audiences 700-odd students staff crammed hall tonight Zumbi dos Pradares, Afro-Brazilian university, she's still greeted wave raised arms audience snaps away mobile phones. In convoy moments before, wrapped shawl, suffering cold angry delays pushed us side streets speckled box-like bars, warehouses love hotels Brazilian motorists sought cut path. There sign now. With metabolism born politician, feeds energy audience takes questions students, teachers local celebrities hour. Hillary Clinton never looks happier centre stage. Most US secretaries state wouldn't bother sort event, much less initiate arrange screened biggest local channel. Yet Clinton almost every foreign trip - seems spend half life official 727, crammed long-time aides armed bodyguards. The schedule backbreaking constantly shifting. She notched quarter million miles since taking office. On Latin America trip, thrown confusion earthquake Chile, already visited four countries 24 hours. We go tiny Uruguay, stay brief check hotel shower; Argentina, spend almost time presidential palace; Chile itself, don't leave airport; Brazil, spend almost full day. So exactly Clinton trying never-ending world tour? Travelling week, talking people inside outside administration, I tried find out. "We case make case made president prime minister foreign minister ambassador," tells weeks later, perches sofa expansive office, view Lincoln Memorial. "People voice opinion vote many instances direction societies take ... I want model different kind leadership open willing listen [also] stand ground necessary." She argues trips help restore US's image wake Bush administration - making contact public opinion abroad, boosting American power. Her aides say that, battle-hardened politician also happens one famous women world, ideally placed carry task. But deeper question whether merely implementing foreign policy crafted Barack Obama, boss former rival, whether role - ambitions - go beyond that. Is kind saleswoman-in-chief US, I ask? "Well, I think part job," replies, toying napkin underneath glass water. "If making case American values American leadership, make people get information ... Given bridges build repair work do, travel." As S'ao Paulo, system strain - "I've fighting day," says masks cough set allergies (Washington's cherry blossom trees shedding flowers). Life still hectic - volcanic ash cloud paralysed Europe televisions throughout State Department showing first British election debate. But Clinton remains enthusiastic, affable unhurried, speech peppered exclamations "oh gosh", even discusses issues state. She politely asks I updates Europe's airspace shutdown tells she's talking Norway's foreign minister it. "He said dust gets engines size, even Air Force One - it's chunky! I don't know else describe it," says, odd note hilarity entering voice pronounces word "chunky". Clinton often speaks eager, unvarnished way - world away clipped, on-message manner immediate predecessor post, Condoleezza Rice. If anything, undiplomat - known less calibrated circumlocutions plain speaking sometimes gaffes, woman retains formidable political constituency laugh admitted send cats scurrying room. Her staff point third elected politician 60 years served secretary state, first come outside foreign policy establishment since James Baker, George H.W. Bush's right-hand man perhaps illustrious recent predecessor. She may substantive politician office since William Jennings Bryan, three-time presidential candidate served secretary almost century ago. "Her stature world stage, almost presidential stature, set apart," Bill Burns, top career diplomat State Department, tells me. "Leaders want meet her. And town hall meetings make difference public opinion." State visitor Hillary Clinton greeted Air Force Base Commander Colonel Celso de Araujo S'ao Paulo airport March Back Sao Paulo, meeting university ranges far confines dramatis personae traditional diplomacy. Annie, young woman red blue dreadlocked hair, tells Clinton dance percussion classes asks study US without paying college fees. A nervous young man confesses lost halfway abstruse question tariff policy; Clinton, smiling nodding vaguely automatic way hers, bears same. Another female student asks autograph. When answering, Clinton sometimes opens eyes wide emphasises phrase; moments, seemingly random, pulls hands apart demonstrating size fish. Then law student called Marina asks abortion - illegal Brazil - Clinton moves treacherous terrain. She speaks Brazilian hospital visited 1990s treated expectant mothers women suffering consequences backstreet abortions. "Wealthy women rights every country," says. "And poor women don't." Her strength feeling can't hidden denounces "the great toll illegal abortions take denial women able exercise fundamental personal right". Tom Shannon, US ambassador Brazil, tells later: "I understand possible concern might come close domestic issues. But wasn't laying prescription Brazil. She sharing experience woman American politics secretary state." It's true: Clinton doesn't quite cross line. Onstage, controlled without seeming artificial, convivial without appearing over-effusive, previous age would call real trouper. At podium looks straight ahead, lips carefully expressionless. Still, old competitive instincts haven't left her. Perhaps lecterns press conferences, reminiscent Democratic presidential debates, exiting podium joint appearance Argentina's president Cristina Fernandez, Clinton makes clear satisfaction last word. The expert debater usually bested Obama left stage. Yet competitive urge coexists one insider describes "almost inhuman loyalty" towards Obama. Her mastery facts - "information carnivore" one officials calls - comes despite consensus much Washington role consists largely implementing foreign policy Obama inner circle framed, rather helping frame herself. In Sao Paulo, shows loyalty striking fashion asked repeatedly positive discrimination - another sensitive topic Brazil - least because, Clinton observes, Afro- Brazilians account half country's population 2 per cent university students. "That suggests special steps need taken [in] recruiting admitting students chance succeed," tells hall, inching towards domestic politics, speaking pride progress US civil rights movement made past half-century. She says: "The election Barack Obama, many believe, greatest accomplishment demonstrated African-American could elected president United States." Among crowd, I catch breath scribble words. It's hard think fulsome statement woman fought hard Obama - squandered huge poll lead millions dollars struggle him. The great collaborator Clinton established strong working relationships within Obama administration When I ask Clinton later managed move antagonism primary race obedience office, dismisses question anodyne "that's politics". She adds: "We're working really hard well together ... It never comes more, seems like ancient history me." Not ancient, I think, willing admit failings campaign. "I always run inclusive successful organisations," retorts I ask whether she'd applied lessons searing experience new post. She admits didn't want job State - says exhausted election missed Senate -. "but end day, I'm pretty old-fashioned president asks something, you'd better really good reason can't." Also, adds: "Suppose I won I asking cabinet ... I would wanted say yes." Others say relationship complex, dint loyalty unflagging hard work, Clinton moved closer charmed circle made even formidable political force before. "Quite simply, gives good advice president year half recognised that," says Anne-Marie Slaughter, head State Department policy planning unit. "The relationship based performance job." By accounts, it's collaborative partnership, though perhaps warm one. Clinton boasts good working relationship main players administration - formed something alliance defence secretary Robert Gates, although life-and-death issues Afghanistan, Gates, her, taken lead. As one official told me, secretaries state often either popular department - Colin Powell comes mind - rest administration - Condoleezza Rice - Clinton managed both. In truth, Clinton's language remains harder-edged Obama's - recently claimed Iran's Revolutionary Guard staged slow-motion coup - sometimes willing hint using military. "She seems step bit spine right time," says Kurt Volker, US ambassador Nato George W. Bush. She also assumed ever prominent role talking leaders Benjamin Netanyahu Israel Hamid Karzai Afghanistan - apparently trusted Obama. Meanwhile, careful keep husband, former US president, background. Aides say barely seen building - though Clinton says behind scenes Bill Clinton gives strategic advice. "One favourite sayings, I remind time, kind baseball saying," says: "Don't major minors; keep eye headlines trend lines." It co-operative stance rather notable effort set grand vision chief theme time far State. When I ask Clinton name proudest achievement office, replies "the effective collaborative approach administration taken towards identifying solving problems." A process-oriented, less provocative answer would hard imagine. But maybe, I think, US less scope grand strategy past couple decades, country seemed bestride world colossus-style. Clinton suggests formidable tasks confronting US administration little scope enter internecine fights needs instead focus challenges hand. Whatever reason stance, seems smart decision - accounts she's overcome many suspicions White House retinue towards her. "It's fair say born administration's inner circle slowly surely, consequential decisions, prime seat table," says one official. Praising calls "Terminator-quality durability determination," adds: "She's done amazing amount work, judging way build strategic vision bottom up, mastering details." Indeed, Clinton's ability master arcane foreign policy briefs marvel building. She dropped obscure working groups shown unnerving knowledge details. At confirmation hearings last year exchanged facts arctic Alaskan senator; meeting So Paulo becomes enthused freight transport policy Brazil US. She acknowledges finding feet foreign policy something struggle, despite campaign claims expertise field. "It intellectually challenging, get arms around issues," says. During first year, criticised apparent gaffes - including way called Israel halt building settlements occupied territory hail partial freeze months later unprecedented. On election campaign, says, "you may different city four times day message you're trying deliver repetitive aimed audience. But might deal 10 different countries' problems, six different regional global challenges course day." As Latin America tour shows, trying - travel incessantly solve array international issues. She forefront US's efforts consolidate relations number important countries - predominantly Russia China, also rising powers Brazil, Turkey, Indonesia South Africa - cool anti-American feeling hotspots, notably Pakistan. She says push working, hailing "change public opinion places pretty negative US" - reference Russia Pakistan. But far smooth sailing. Differences Iran Israel's raid aid-bearing ships Gaza stoked tensions Turkey Brazil recently, amid questioning effectiveness Obama administration's policies. During time road, stop Brazil focal point - surprising given country's increased profile Latin America leader. Clinton heading administration's push secure sanctions Iran, Brasilia tries fails win President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva cause. She employs almost combative tone press conference Celso Amorim, Brazil's foreign minister. At moments appears barely contain irritation, denounces "an Iran runs Brazil" well countries Turkey China "telling different things different people avoid international sanctions". Amorim spiky way - drawing parallels 1990s sanctions Iraq claims weapons mass destruction 2003 war. "Of course, I don't agree everything Secretary said," says. It happy experience - indeed past week Brazil Turkey voted sanctions United Nations - yet Hillary Clinton nowhere near giving up. Years ago, one Bill Clinton's biographers described approach government "permanent campaign", appears wife's preferred form existence well. If one constant Clinton's life, never throws cards, whether motivates power public service. "Never, never!" exclaims, I ask whether ever thought walking wings frustrations indignities time White House. "I realistic sense high- stakes politics requires took get it's shocking arena ... figure out, take seriously purposes analysis understanding, can't take personally." Such treatment seems rankle same. She's listening coverage ahead British debate plainly irritated coverage leaders' wives.
