Another country Clinton boards official 727 fly Sao Paulo Costa Rica Injustice towards women appears issue enthuses Clinton job - many incarnations American public life, whether First Lady before. "I feel passionately American national security interests world's, women given opportunities tools make lives," says. In 1990s steered clear reading newspapers way treated. Today, says, "I certainly don't read coverage me, I read else going I need know job." "It's baloney," says Philippe Reines, press adviser, set meeting sitting one side office. "Yeah, yeah, right, that's tells me," Clinton responds. I wonder. She may read stories her, boosted domestic profile still talking American magazines Esquire, Vogue Parade. To end? Clinton said serve one four-year term secretary state - understandable, given grind job. When I ask whether expects woman president next decade so, responds: "I'd love that, obviously I would love that. I want front centre happens." "Any chance would you?" I ask. "No, no, I don't think that's cards," Clinton says. She's given categoric denials past. "I think there's whole generation young women young, mature, seasoned women earning stripes recognising tough there. It faint heart run president, I believe harder women, is, that's fact." But, says one US official, "all profiles media treatment undercut argument finished electoral politics. Why stuff? She's already Hillary Clinton. You ask: 'What's idea behind raising domestic profile still further?" Indeed now, counts, popular politician America Washington say could good fit vice-presidential slot 2012 elections. Back Sao Paulo, town hall meeting over, Clinton faces seven-hour flight Costa Rica. The journey goes on, saleswoman-in-chief US unruly world, faces long, hard road. David Miliband shadow foreign secretary Gideon Rachman: "Relations White House State Department particularly close" A school teacher asked write report Hillary Clinton's stint secretary state would give 10/10 effort rather modest mark actual achievements - maybe six seven. Secretaries state generally judged two criteria. First, done endless bureaucratic turf wars characterise Washington politics? Second, effective promoting US foreign policy wider world? Success one area usually helps other. Henry Kissinger superb Washington infighter - close relationship President Nixon made effective overseas. Colin Powell, George W. Bush's first secretary state, widely admired outside US - came wrong side many Washington battles, limited ability get things done wider world. Hillary Clinton skilfully avoided sucked debilitating Washington struggles damaged Powell. Despite often poisonous rivalry Obama Clinton camps campaign, Clinton good working relationship president. But relations White House State Department cordial, seem particularly close. Clinton appointed many loyalists campaign State Department, result State rather detached Obama's inner circle. Obama's penchant making high-profile speeches foreign capitals Cairo, Prague, Tokyo Istanbul means president done anyone else define administration's approach world. That still leaves role Clinton fill crucial details policy. But special representatives appointed deal Afghanistan Middle East - Treasury critical China policy. Asked Clinton's impact secretary state, one senior European policymaker purses lips says: "She's done great trips, she's highly professional. But it's hard see particular area really driven policy." Gideon Rachman FT's chief foreign affairs columnist David Rothkopf: "When asked deliver tough messages, done unflinchingly" Hillary Clinton cautious secretary state: protected president well pursued agenda without upstaging - early concern, given stature. She worked well members cabinet, reconsidering role structure State Department. That includes review role diplomacy going forward. Clinton acknowledged rise new powers changing global power structure taken steps reshape US foreign policy structure accordingly. An important part recognising importance co-operating private non-state actors NG0s, well dealing non-state threats. When administration called upon deliver tough messages, done unflinchingly. This allowed president articulate strategic vision Clinton goes implementing. Still, neither secretary state president determines global situation. The US may powerful country world one among many powerful countries, many aspects situation face today beyond control. The Obama administration dealt extremely difficult hand: Iraq Afghanistan, Iran North Korea's nuclear programmes, rise emerging powers complex still unfolding series financial crises. We gone world US thought limitless resources unbounded options one limits clear; world could work GB one work context G20; world new technologies new powers play bigger role. All things would dictate change foreign policy regardless office. Hillary Clinton established solid foundation. The next step identify couple signature issues - couple signature successes. That take next level. David Rothkopf visiting scholar Carnegie Endowment International Peace expertise national security

Aides U.S. general Afghanistan slam Obama: report 20 mins ago WASHINGTON (Reuters) — Aides top U.S. general Afghanistan insulted President Barack Obama's closest advisers, calling one "clown" another "wounded animal," article published Friday Rolling Stone magazine. The article also quotes aide describing commander U.S. NATO forces Afghanistan General Stanley McChrystal's "disappointment" initial one-on-one meeting Obama last year. Quoting McChrystal aides anonymously, article portrays split U.S. military Obama's advisers extremely sensitive moment Pentagon, fending criticism strategy turn around nearly nine-year-old Afghan war. The Pentagon immediate comment article, brought attention senior officials. It quotes member McChrystal's team making jokes Vice President Joe Biden, seen critical general's efforts escalate conflict favored limited counter-terrorism approach. "Biden?" aide quoted saying. "Did say: Bite me?" Another aide called White House National Security Adviser Jim Jones, retired four star general, "clown" "stuck 1985." It quoted adviser McChrystal dismissing early meeting Obama "10-minute photo op." "Obama clearly didn't know anything him, was. The boss pretty disappointed," adviser told magazine. McChrystal, famous workaholic said sleep four hours day, brought Afghanistan year ago predecessor pushed out. The article portrays teams disapproving Obama administration, exception Secretary State Hillary Clinton, backed McCrystal's request additional troops Afghanistan. Some strongest criticism reserved Richard Holbrooke, Obama's special envoy Afghanistan Pakistan. "The boss says he's like wounded animal," member general's team quoted saying. "Holbrooke keeps hearing rumors he's going get fired, makes dangerous." McChrystal quoted saying felt "betrayed" leak classified cable U.S. Ambassador Afghanistan Karl Eikenberry last year. The cable raised doubts sending troops shore Afghan government already lacking credibility. "I like Karl, I've known years, they'd never said anything like us before," McChrystal quoted saying article. "Here's one covers flank history books. Now fail, say, 'I told so." Mills, Cheryl D <MillsCD©state.gov> Tuesday, June 22, 2010 8:14 AM FW: Rahm's long goodbye Rahm's long goodbye By: Glenn Thrush June 22, 2010 04:34 AM EDT For talk Rahm Emanuel reaching "eject" button, fiery White House chief staff isn't leaving immediate future — could serve well 2011, according people close him. "It's opinion top levels White House Rahm going longer many people think," said senior administration official, speaking condition anonymity. Speculation Emanuel's departure favorite parlor game nearly year — stoked Emanuel's admission he'd love run Chicago mayor (should current' Mayor Richard Daley retire, course), kvetching rigors job, withering attacks left right fact average expiration date chief staff 18 months. Emanuel leaving, departure date proved profoundly elastic. Friends co-workers said vacillates day day, sometimes minute minute. He might leave December midterms; might stay next summer, depending whether Daley runs President Barack Obama asks stick around, said. And even pines native Chicago, Emanuel continues put real roots D.C., recently writing check enroll children exclusive Maret School Washington 2011 school year, according person close Emanuel. He's shown signs loosening grip tiller — bombarding White House staffers long-distance calls first days Gulf oil spill even traveled Israel son's bar mitzvah. And broader sense, it's hard imagine Emanuel's huge personality extracted political, journalistic bar stool life Obama's Washington. Take last game last week's NBA Finals, American voter could wander Tunnicliff's Tavern Capitol Hill witness one powerful men nation egging Boston Celtics — screaming flat-screen TV, actually — joined merry band included Sen. Max Baucus (D-Mont.); Sen. Chris Dodd (D-Conn.); Jim Manley, spokesman Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid (D-Nev.); pair favorite reporters The New York Times The Washington Post. Despite British tabloid story asserting Emanuel sick Obama's "idealism" racing exit, former Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee chairman still loves attention power current job hasn't made mind he's leaving, people know said. "This BS. And need translation, baseless," Emanuel said statement pushing back story U.K.'s Daily Telegraph portraying Emanuel restless! fed up. Replacing Emanuel, eventually goes, easy task Obama small clique close advisers led Pete Rouse, David Axelrod Valerie Jarrett. For one thing, Obama company need know post-November political landscape looks like picking successor: If Republicans take back one house Congress, new chief staff need know leverage executive power hostile Hill; Democrats retain majorities, Emanuel's successor need legislative skills. Barring major course correction, Obama, prizes loyalty familiarity, isn't likely reach far outside inner circle, advisers said. Still, president increasingly cognizant reputation insularity would quite likely give serious look respected former Clinton chiefs staff Leon Panetta, currenW head CIA, John Podesta, runs Center American Progress, major liberal think tank close ties administration. Rouse, senior adviser served Obama's Senate chief staff, considered best pure manager White House logical choice replace Emanuel, according half-dozen.administration officials consultants. But Rouse's colleagues say quiet 60-year-old insider loves work, Grateful Dead cats — despises spotlight would likely turn job unless Obama insisted. "The key thing Pete president trusts would feel very, comfortable charge," said Democratic consultant knows men well. "But probably won't take it." One possible candidate — deputy chief staff Jim Messina, Emanuel's political go-to guy — likely play major role Obama's 2012 reelection campaign expected move Chicago sometime next year. In Messina's absence, another Emanuel favorite — Deputy National Security Adviser Tom Donilon — emerged possible successor, according people close situation. Obama impressed Donilon's presentations President's Daily Briefing, Rhode Island native wide variety political governmental experience, serving congressional liaison President Jimmy Carter, chief State Department spokesman President Bill Clinton campaign adviser helped Obama prepare debates John McCain. One major Donilon drawback: He served executive vice president Fannie Mae, bailed-out mortgage giant, reportedly lobbied stronger regulatory oversight. David Plouffe, Obama's 2008 campaign manager, another contender, reputation discipline, team building solid management skills. But Plouffe reluctant settle Washington, earning stellar living consultant hates press. Former Senate Majority Leader Tom Daschle also possible successor, even though nomination Health Human Services secretary scuttled revelations failed report limo rides paid corporate client. Another White House aide, Phil Schiliro, favorite Obama's legislative savvy political instincts. But critics said lacks range policy political experience candidates possess, mastery Hill won't mean much Democrats surrender majorities either house. Then there's Ron Klain, 49, Vice President Joe Biden's brainy politically astute chief staff, said intensely interested making move Eisenhower Executive Office Building West Wing. Klain — also served Al Gore's chief staff — well-regarded inside White House. Plus, he's got touch star power: Kevin Spacey played HBO movie "Recount," role guiding Gore campaign 2000 Florida recount. Klain's downside: He's essentially outsider yet develop serious rapport president, according insiders. C 2010 Capitol News Company, LLC

The Australian - 19 Jun 10 Embracing everyone US India Greg Sheridan, Foreign editor GEORGE Yeo, Singapore's Foreign Minister, one dazzlingly clever people could meet Southeast Asia. Singapore society notoriously produces hardheads strategic outlook. But Yeo combines Singapore's characteristic hard-headedness depth historical understanding context, well lively human sympathy diversity region surrounds him, I, event, find almost unique. I remember interviewing height East Asian economic crisis 1997 asking whether crisis shattered idea Asia growing centre global economy, numerous foolishly triumphalist Western commentators suggesting. "No doesn't," Yeo told me. "At might put back forecasts five 10 years." It moved graph little right, didn't change trends. On that, Yeo absolutely right. But also Yeo's ability apply insights history real problems Asia today make formidable. This week, Yeo spent days Australia I caught one slightly mesmerising historical tour de force conversations specialises. It secret Singapore serious reservations Kevin Rudd's proposal establish Asia-Pacific Community. The Prime Minister wanted US, India Russia included regional body could deal strategic issues well trade economics. Singapore's hesitation Rudd proposal came thought Association Southeast Asian Nations, key member, could sidelined. I asked Yeo whether region clear wanted organisations accomplish. "We still need lot discussion," said. "The vision going change dramatically, emergence China India global stage. The configuration evolving much faster us would preferred. But that's reality we've got work with. We need regional architecture able accommodate stresses. The single important relationship US China. Increasingly, relationship India China becoming important. I think eventually triangular relationship decide big issues war peace Asia century - triangle consisting US, China India." Yeo saw Rudd Foreign Minister Stephen Smith Canberra describes Canberra Singapore harmony evolution regional organisations. This saw played out: "When Prime Minister Rudd proposed APC, Dick Woolcott (Rudd's envoy) went round region. He visit countries. He made quite plain big countries ASEAN need involved. We talked among quite soon conclusion reached ASEAN going sidelined. So immediate blowback region. "To PM Rudd's credit quickly clarified this, ASEAN central conception APC vision beginning. I said, 'All us region relieved hear that'. "Separately (former Japanese) prime minister (Yukio) Hatoyama articulating view East Asian region apparently centred China, Japan Korea. It created, would expect, natural reaction Southeast Asia. That got us thinking region. How keep Russia US region way that's comfortable. For long time we've thinking China, recently India." Yeo pointed earlier regional organisations also evolved slowly, particular East Asia Summit, includes Australia New Zealand, well ASEAN, China, Japan, South Korea India. He said: "It took us long time create EAS structure. Some preferred based ASEAN plus three (China, Japan, Korea), harking back (former Malaysian prime minister) Mahathir (Mohamad)'s East Asian caucus. "Others felt that's limiting. If it's ASEAN plus three, may little lop-sided economic weight plus three. So thought India one side, Australia New Zealand south, there's certain natural equipoise. "Then took many discussions. The Russians wanted join EAS felt rushed. Russia important country. There unhappiness Russians accommodate EAS time. (Former US) President (George W.) Bush want join EAS worried EAS might exclude US region. We told American friends could purely Asian thing Australia New Zealand it. In case, countries like Singapore would never want EAS exclusive. What would threaten us world developed blocs." So end today? "When I met PM Rudd I thanked helping catalyse thinking ASEAN. So two possibilities, either EAS expanded Russia US separate ASEAN plus eight (including US Russia) configuration. In fact I interesting discussion Prime Minister Rudd. I think end he's happy let ASEAN members decide doesn't want interfere regional discussion." So describe Yeo outlines either win loss Rudd. Whatever evolves, nobody going call Asia-Pacific Community one going imagine Rudd founder, everyone accepts Bob Hawke founded APEC 1989. On hand, seem though it's much likely finally regional organisation embracing everyone US India, able discuss security. That pretty much Rudd's policy aim and, Yeo constructively puts it, Rudd influenced ASEAN thinking. Friends Rudd describe embodiment vision fulfilment initiative. His enemies say APC came nothing failure Australian diplomacy. Certainly Yeo casts constructive light. There space give smallest sampling Yeo's prodigiously rich insights issues. On US, said: "Both Australia Singapore feel bones US remain great power many decades. It vast country always throwing new ideas, always boil. It sunny disposition. We Singapore Australia feel bones one way another get current difficulties." On China, I asked whether political development keeping pace growth power, financial military, could manage new power way beneficial everybody. Yeo stressed sure Beijing's preoccupations internal, said: "China No 1 trading partner Japan, Korea, Taiwan, Hong Kong, India already No 2 New Zealand, countries (in Asia) graph points direction." (The historical process) high drama China. It historically large rural peasantry Maoism developed different ideology Bolshevism. China 20 per cent urban. It's 40 per cent urban go 80 per cent 90 per cent. The urbanisation Europe languid comparison, look Dickens Victor Hugo. Look huge reaction Europe urbanisation industrialisation. In China it's compressed. If succeed greatest nation Earth. The Chinese know learn new tricks. The skills brought power won't keep power." He recalled early China's economic modernisation program fascinated Singapore, mostly Chinese nation, ran society orderly effective manner, combining rapid economic growth social order respect tradition. Then interest seemed wane. But Chinese delegations back large numbers, fascinated particularly Singapore manages politics big booming city. Mainland Chinese even sitting politicians' electoral clinics Singapore, observing real problems recognised, integrated system dealt with. I asked Yeo whether thought Japan could sustain stabilising role played Asia past 60 years. He replied: "Their politics mess. Partly fit pieces together closely, reconfiguring pieces is- difficult. A lot Japanese politics fitting pieces together pulling apart. "The DP1 came power determined pull pieces apart, Liberal Democratic Party big business bureacracy. Never write Japan off. It takes long time change change fury intensity surprises everyone." Japan gone profound periods change past - Meiji Restoration 19th century, decided become modern nation; pervasive change World War II, decided embrace democracy role key US ally region. The fact grappling change reason think cannot emerge successful model. Yeo old, old friend Australia, sense long-term champion Australia's involvement Southeast Asia. He minister Singapore government 20 years. He embodies great deal institutional memory strategic continuity, within Singapore within broader councils region. It's pity doesn't visit us bit often.

Lowey Remove Assistance Afghanistan From Foreign Aid Bill Chairwoman Announces Oversight Hearings Corruption Afghanistan WASHINGTON — In light two troubling news reports corruption within Afghan government, Congresswoman Nita Lowey (D-NY), Chairwoman Appropriations State Foreign Operations Subcommittee, today announced removing funding Afghanistan beyond humanitarian aid 2011 bill scheduled markup week. "The alleged shipment billions donor funds Afghanistan allegations Afghan government insiders impeding corruption investigations outrageous," said Lowey. "I intend appropriate one dime assistance Afghanistan I confidence U.S. taxpayer money abused line pockets corrupt Afghan government officials, drug lords, terrorists. Furthermore, government Afghanistan must demonstrate corruption aggressively investigated prosecuted. "Rampant corruption fosters conditions threaten security troops stability Afghan government economy." The State Foreign Operations Appropriations Subcommittee mark Fiscal Year 2011 Appropriations Act Wednesday June 30th. The subcommittee consider bilateral assistance Afghan government lifesaving humanitarian aid time. Lowey also announced Subcommittee hold oversight hearings July 4th recess get bottom allegations. "Too many Americans suffering economy us put hard-earned tax dollars hands criminals overseas," said Lowey. "We commit billions taxpayer money Afghanistan assurances funds used intended purposes government Afghanistan willing able root corruption within ranks. U.S. taxpayers deserve nothing less."

May 6, 2010, 6:11 amIt's Not About Greece AnymoreBy PETER BOONE AND SIMON JOHNSONLouisa Gouliamaki/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images Protesters waved flags Acropolis archaeological site behind banners English Greek hung front Parthenon temple Athens.Peter Boone chairman charity Effective Intervention research associate Center Economic Performance London School Economics. He also principal Salute Capital Management Ltd. Simon Johnson, former chief economist International Monetary Fund, co-author "13 Bankers."The Greek "rescue" package announced last weekend dramatic, unprecedented far enough stabilize euro zone.The Greek government European Union leadership, prodded International Monetary Fund, finally becoming realistic dire economic situation Greece. They abandoned previous rounds optimistic forecasts admitted profoundly worse situation. This new program calls "fiscal adjustments" — cuts fiscal deficit, mostly spending cuts — totaling 11 percent gross domestic product 2010, 4.3 percent 2011, 2 percent 2012 2013. The total debt-to-G.D.P. ratio peaks 149 percent 2012-13 starting gentle glide path back sanity.This new program honest enough show unlikely succeed.Daniel Gros, eminent economist euro zone issues based Brussels, argued 1 percent G.D.P. decline Greek government spending, total demand country falls 2.5 percent G.D.P. If government reduces spending 15 percent G.D.P. — initial shock demand could well 30 percent G.D.P.Obviously simple rule work large numbers, illustrates Greece likely experience sharp recession — substantial uncertainty around bad economy get. The program announced last weekend assumes Greek G.D.P. falls 4 percent year, another 2.6 percent 2011, recovering positive growth 2012 beyond.Such figures seem extremely optimistic, particularly face civil unrest sweeping Greece deep hostility expressed toward Greece northern European policy circles.The pattern growth critical because, program, Greece needs grow debt problem soon. Greece's debt-to-G.D.P. ratio debilitating 145 percent end 2011.Now consider putting realistic growth figures I.M.F. forecast Greece's economy — e.g., G.D.P. declining 12 percent 2011, debt-to-G.D.P. ratio may reach 155 percent. At levels, 5 percent real interest rate growth, country needs primary surplus 8 percent G.D.P. keep debt-to- G.D.P. ratio stable. It nowhere near level. The I.M.F. program Greece running primary budget deficit around 1 percent G.D.P. year, assumes path Greek growth regarded "upside scenario."The politics implied budget surpluses remains brutal. Since Greek debt held abroad, roughly 80 percent budget savings Greek government makes go straight Germans, French foreign debt holders (mostly banks). If growth turns poorly, Greeks prepared ever-tougher austerity pay Germans? Even everything goes well, Greek citizens seem unlikely welcome version "new normal." Last week European leadership panicked — late day — realized euro zone risk meltdown. If euro zone proves unwilling protect member like Greece default, bond investors run Portugal Spain also — doubt this, study carefully interlocking debt picture published recently The New York Times. Higher yields government debt would caused concerns potential bank runs nations, spread nations Europe.When "run," clear stops. In hazy distance, Belgium, France, Austria many others potentially risk. Even Germans cannot afford bail nations.Slapped face ugly scenario, Europeans decided throw everything I.M.F. bailing Greece. The program announced small chance preventing eventual Greek bankruptcy, may still slow avert dangerous spiral downward — enormous collateral damage — rest Europe.The I.M.F. floated fashion alternative scenario debt restructuring, rejected European Union Greek authorities. This surprise; leading European policy makers completely unprepared broader problems would follow Greek "restructuring," markets would immediately mark debt (i.e., increase yields) Portugal, Spain, Ireland even Italy.The fear panic face would unparalleled modern times: When Greeks pay 50 percent face value debt, investors expect Portuguese Spanish? It becomes arbitrary, including countries dragged down.Someone decide defended cost, European structures completely unsuited kind tough decision-making pressurein extreme downside scenario, Germany obvious safe haven within euro zone, government bond yields would collapse governments face sharply rising yields. The euro zone would likely hold together.There still narrow escape path, without immediate debt default chaos would produce:- Talk euro — moving toward parity American dollar would help lift growth across euroz one.- As euro falls, bond yields rise euro zone periphery. This create episodes panic. Enough short-term financing must place support rollover government debt.. Once euro fallen great deal, announce European Central Bank support euro levels (i.e., prevent appreciation, G-20 tacit agreement), also support peripheral euro zone nations viewed solvent buying bonds whenever markets chaotic.• At stage, before, euro zone leadership needs push weaker governments restructure. That include Greece perhaps also Portugal. Hopefully, scenario Spain muddle through.• European banks recapitalized necessary management replaced. This massive failure euro groupthink — including notably political level — question bank executives behaved responsibly long replaced en masse.To extent possible, ensuing losses shared bank creditors. But careful wish for. The bankers powerful reason; built vital yet fragile structures heart economies. Dismantle care.

Top 2 Civilians Face Rockiness Afghan Shift By MARK LANDLER The New York Times Thu, July 1, 2010 WASHINGTON — As General David H. Petraeus takes command Afghanistan, two top American civilian officials war face uncertain tricky future, working newly empowered military leader, gaze impatient president put notice fractious war council needs pull together. Richard C. Holbrooke, Obama administration's special representative region, Karl W. Eikenberry, ambassador Afghanistan, hung jobs uproar followed Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal's career- ending quotes Rolling Stone magazine. But privately, least one senior White House official suggested using General McChrystal's exit excuse housecleaning, according senior officials. That rejected disruptive military campaign relies heavily civilian support, people said. In recent days, administration officials begun floating idea Ambassador Eikenberry might replaced Ryan C. Crocker, highly regarded former ambassador Iraq forged close partnership General Petraeus successful Iraq troop increase. Such prospect viewed remote, given Mr. Crocker's prestigious new post Texas A&M University. But fact name invoked underlines challenges confront Ambassador Eikenberry, adapts new partner — one strong ideas soldiers diplomats work together war. It also illustrates remarkably powerful role General Petraeus assume nine-year-old war, setting almost viceroy Afghanistan key broker negotiations President Hamid Karzai Pakistan eventual political settlement. Prior General Petraeus's arrival, critics said White House created problem recruiting several forceful, ambitious personalities giving jobs overlapping responsibilities. Administration officials acknowledge that, one said, "There obviously number substantial personalities team." But White House believes current lineup mesh, difficult war demands much talent. Still, McChrystal blow-up reverberated State Department. Secretary State Hillary Rodham Clinton instructed Ambassador Eikenberry Mr. Holbrooke take hard look civilian team, two officials said. She wedded current lineup continues bog internecine battles, said. "You can't major shift civ-mil structure without civilian side take step back look everything," said senior State Department official, using jargon civilian-military campaign. Be General Petraeus, whose appointment approved 99-0 Senate Wednesday, took pains confirmation hearing Tuesday back unified civilian military effort. He noted telephoned Mr. Holbrooke would rendezvous Ambassador Eikenberry Brussels, two could land Kabul together. "Holbrooke wingman, great degree," General Petraeus said interview. "We had, have, good relationship." That role, said, fall Ambassador Eikenberry. Ambassador Eikenberry highly critical Pentagon's proposal last year send 60,000 additional troops Afghanistan, led difficult relationship General McChrystal. But fact General Petraeus true architect plan. The ambassador, retired lieutenant general former commander Afghanistan, graduated West Point 1973, year ahead General Petraeus, know academy. The two share scholarly bent: General Petraeus holds Ph.D. Princeton, Ambassador Eikenberry Master's degrees Harvard Stanford. While never assigned together, careers intersected twice. In Iraq, General Eikenberry led assessment Iraqi security forces General Petraeus commanding 101st Airborne Division Mosul. When General Eikenberry commander Afghanistan, General Petraeus led assessment Afghan National Security Forces. General Petraeus declined discuss personnel issues, Ambassador Eikenberry Mr. Holbrooke turned requests interview. Mr. Crocker, dean George Bush School Government Texas A&M, return call comment. For Mr. Holbrooke, new landscape challenging ways. Officials said job security less doubt six months ago, ouster subject endless Washington chatter. Yet arguably become less central player: Jacob J. Lew, deputy secretary state, manages much civilian influx Afghanistan Mr. Holbrooke helped shape, embassy Kabul carrying out. Mr. Holbrooke's current portfolio played weaknesses, allies admit. He best high-level negotiator, comfortable nitty-gritty work helping Afghanistan build economy. These days, Mr. Holbrooke become globe-trotting diplomat, trying retain flagging European allies seeking draw influential Muslim countries like Egypt helping Afghanistan. At recent conference 35 countries Madrid, Mr. Holbrooke drummed support allies Afghan government's campaign reintegrate Taliban fighters mainstream society. Mr. Karzai's longer-term effort reconcile Taliban leaders, negotiations Pakistan, could propel Mr. Holbrooke back central role. Were talks become serious, several officials said, Mr. Holbrooke's negotiating skills could put use, broker guardian American interests. For now, though, evidence General Petraeus's influence, shuttling Kabul Islamabad. On last visit region, Mr. Holbrooke met Mr. Karzai senior Pakistani officials, including army chief staff, Ashfaq Parvez Kayani. Mr. Holbrooke's past run-ins Mr. Karzai, several officials said, hindered ability deal Afghan leader, Pakistani officials said trusted him. Husain Haqqani, Pakistan's ambassador Washington, said Mr. Holbrooke took time understand Pakistan's concerns. "Ambassador Holbrooke liked some, admired others seen effective, even may like him," Mr. Haqqani said. Still, General Petraeus indisputably key player, wasted time asserting control. On secure videoconference call last Saturday, person familiar call said, General Petraeus threw support behind costly, controversial, plan install temporary generators supply electricity Kandahar, Taliban stronghold next major American military target. Mr. Holbrooke Ambassador Eikenberry swiftly assented.

Madam Secretary, As requested, brief bio (compiled DK, INR, AF) Kenyan Vice Minister Foreign Affairs Richard Momoima Onyonka, met Krakow Community Democracies. Please let know would like information follow this. Thanks, Mike Richard Momoima Onyonka Kenyan politician belongs People's Democratic Party. Born 1962 hailing Bogeka clan, VM Momoima lived Otamba, Nyamataro, Mosocho Nairobi. In 1982, following failed Kenyan coup d'etat attempt overthrow President Daniel Arap Moi's government, VM Momoima among 900 people jailed. However, 1984, returned University Nairobi graduated Bachelors degree commerce year later. After graduation, VM Momoima attended North Carolina State University graduated Masters degree management. He returned Kenya 1992 first multi party elections help father (then incumbent MP Kitutu Chache Minister Planning National Development) seeking re-election KANU (Kenya African National Union) ticket. VM Momoima's first political opportunity arose father passed away 1996, prompted election lost new corner party (KANU) nominations. Since Kenyan parliamentary election 2007, VM Momoima represented Kitutu Chache Constituency National Assembly Kenya. A financial economist profession, VM Momoima currently runs personal businesses Nairobi Kisii held positions Kisii KANU branch. His priorities include economic empowerment, particularly youth women, education, poverty reduction. Michael H. Fuchs U.S. Department State (202) 647-1709 B6

'Inept' US cannot fix Afghanistan: top Saudi prince Sun, May 16, 2010 RIYADH (AFP)— An "inept" United States cannot fix Afghanistan's problems simply focus "chasing terrorists" there, former Saudi intelligence chief Prince Turki al-Faisal said Saturday. The ex-ambassador United States also challenged Washington produce results just-started Middle East peace talks, accused US Secretary State Hillary Clinton undermining efforts make region nuclear-free. AFP — Saudi Arabia's former intelligence chief Prince Turki al-Faisal delivers speech conference ... In speech Riyadh diplomats, Turki said US-led NATO troops irrevocably alienated Afghan people hope rebuilding country. "What Afghanistan needs shift nation-building effectively countering terrorists," Turki told Arab News conference. US President Barack Obama "should misdirected believing fix Afghanistan's ills military means." "Hunt terrorists sides Afghan-Pakistan border, arrest kill them, get out, let Afghan people deal problems. "As long GI boots remain Afghan soil, remain targets resistance Afghan people ideological mercenaries." Turki, long served central role Saudi-Afghan relations, scolded Washington's handling relations Kabul. "The inept way administration dealt President (Hamid) Karzai beggars disbelief amazement. "Both sides filled resentment sour taste mouths," said. "How get situation? I don't know." The chairman King Faisal Center For Research Islamic Studies, Turki official position believed often reflect high level thinking Saudi government. He brother Foreign Minister Prince Saud al-Faisal, analysts speculate could become foreign minister Saud retires. Turki said Arab states given Washington four months show progress US-guided Palestinian-Israeli peace talks. "The Arab world given Obama September get things done," said Turki. "It enough talk talk. He walk walk. "If succeed... I (will) ask President Obama morally decent gesture recognise Palestinian state ardently wishes exist. "He pack leave us peace let Palestinians, Syrians Lebanese negotiate directly Israelis. No platitudes good wishes visions, please." Turki also faulted US European approach trying halt Iran's alleged efforts build nuclear weapon. "The discussions Iran's nuclear ambitions started wrong foot. The carrot stick approach work," said. For one, said, US Europe double-standards dealing Iran one hand, nuclear countries other. "You cannot ask Iran play one level allow Israel, India, Pakistan, North Korea play levels." Turki said successful strategy toward Iran requires even-handedness, "universal nuclear security umbrella" countries area, "a good military option" regional country cooperate. He said Clinton undermined efforts move toward regional nuclear-free zone, UN Security Council's five permanent members recently expressed support idea. "Alas... Clinton voided issue value stating conditions yet exist establishing zone," said. "Why, then, join members P5 issuing statement?" Turki said hoped Obama "will find way correct secretary state's nullification making area free weapons mass destruction." Turki also warned rising violence Iraq pullout US troops next year, warning internal external groups seek carve country. "Imagine happen internal strife fighting escalates" following US pullout, said. Without UN Security Council effort protect Iraq's current borders, consequence could "regional conflict scale seen since Ottoman-Safavid wars 17th 18th centuries," warned.

FYI, WHA: Mexican law enforcement officials cannot stop individuals require proof migratory status. However, like SB1070, officials course official "contact" (i.e. Traffic stops, investigations, hot pursuit) authorized request proof migratory status. They practice routinely. Frequently, individuals cannot prove legal status referred INM (federal CBP-equivalent). In practice, GoM authorities levels engage exploitative treatment migrants, primarily Central Americans heading US. These abuses well documented international human rights groups, well multiple documentary news media reports.

Will - X0 Cdm Mills, Cheryl D <MillsCD@state.gov> Saturday, May 29, 2010 10:27 AM Re: monday better? B6
HRC: Below oped National Security Strategy I wrote tomorrow's Outlook. Unfortunately, give horrible title, I think piece turned alright. Best, Sandy By Samuel R. Berger Samuel R. Berger, chair global strategy firm Albright Stonebridge Group, served national security advisor President Clinton 1997 2001. President Obama's National Security Strategy, released White House Thursday, tackles delicate unavoidable question: How respond new old security challenges era financial distress home reordering political power abroad? For time now, clear definition U.S. national security strategy needs rethinking. The September 11 attacks, global economic crisis, cyber-terror threats even environmental catastrophe Gulf underscore challenges America faces 2010 changed even decade ago. And America's military supremacy certainly risk, new international arrangements - shift G-7 club powerful nations G-20, incorporates emerging nations China Brazil - needed costs benefits stable international order shared. The United States cannot solve global threats without others, bear burden alone. Enter National Security Strategy. In experience, congressionally mandated documents easily become laborious impenetrable, mere compendiums bureaucratic pleading various parts government. (Make sure right Japan! Don't step Pentagon!) The challenge, President Clinton insisted upon advisers, provide strategic framework clarifying rest world informs administration decision makers line. It's blueprint action, means convey president's principles priorities. In Obama's case, new sober comprehensive 52-page strategy incorporates new realities breaks past strategies several key respects. But also reflects understanding face enduring challenges - nuclear proliferation, terrorism regional conflicts - best response return fundamentals. One fundamental strength economy. At time after-effects financial crisis fiscal burden two long wars raised fears overextended America, administration makes case economic technological renewal crucial underpinning U.S. security. The president made case West Point speech last weekend. "At time human history," said, "has nation diminished economic vitality maintained military political primacy." Another fundamental challenge arms control nuclear proliferation. By seeking strategic arms cuts Russia, president returned long bipartisan tradition languished prior administration. And convening global summit securing nuclear material spring, Obama given new urgency global purchase effort started 1991 Sens. Sam Nunn Richard Lugar first initiated program lock nuclear materials. On terrorism, strategy builds past, breaks well. Presidents Clinton, Bush Obama deployed America's tools: military power, homeland defense, law enforcement, sanctions, intelligence vigorous efforts cut terrorist financing. But critical difference Obama strategy rejects Global War Terror lens prior administration viewed challenge. "This global war tactic - terrorism - religion - Islam," new strategy says. "We war specific network, al-Qaeda terrorist affiliates." This sharper focus avoids alienating many Muslim world, ensures support key allies never accepted broader construct avoids overreactions led us forsake fight al-Qaeda fight Afghanistan turn efforts unrelated threat Saddam Hussein's Iraq. In perhaps dramatic departure strategy predecessor, Obama administration restored less provocative policy use military force. In 2002 national security strategy, President Bush articulated rationale preemptive war weeks seeking U.N. resolution invade Iraq. The new strategy restores principles guided administrations decades: use force last resort, weigh costs benefits, much international support possible. The administration reserves right act unilaterally - example al-Qaeda allies - resurrects principle President Clinton often described "together possible, alone necessary." President Obama's critics focused diplomatic engagement hostile states like Iran North Korea. The President sets forth rationale: "to create opportunities resolve differences, strengthen international community's support actions, learn intentions nature closed regimes, plainly demonstrate public within nations governments blame isolation." In case Iran, Washington's outstretched hand resulted Iran's compliance. But attempts engage helped ensure world's attention focused Iran's intransigence rather Washington's refusal negotiate. Without doubt, gaps principle practice. Despite Obama administration's stated goal doubling exports next five years, put muscle behind trade agreements South Korea, Panama Colombia. And clarity call respect human rights times muted face tough realities. Sixteen months administration much progress, many true tests strategy lie ahead. In strategy's conclusions, Obama administration evokes even earlier era, calling political parties restore cooperation common purpose crucial success dark days Cold War. Despite intense debates time nuclear arms control, Central America détente, nearly American supported containment communism. In spirit, administration's framework deserves broad bipartisan support. We argue differences detention prisoners, methods disarm dangerous states, hard push democratic rights, costs climate change legislation. But time, rally around overriding U.S. foreign policy goals spelled strategy: renewing economy home ensure leadership abroad; defeating al-Qaeda; succeeding Afghanistan; preventing nuclear proliferation; curbing climate change; promoting international order enlightened self-interest, economic prosperity fundamental values upon America based.

State Play As U.S. embarks next stage Israeli-Palestinian process, faces series tactical strategic challenges regarding policy, politics personality. 1. At policy level, meager results indirect talks difficulties transitioning direct talks underscored lack trust two sides well existing substantive gaps. With direct talks begin coming days, one obstacles removed, several remain. Some may resolved connection gaining agreement direct talks. a. How handle renewal non-renewal Israel's settlement moratorium? b. What goal direct talks consensus matter parties? A comprehensive agreement permanent (CAPS) covers details? A framework agreement permanent status (FAPS) outlines governing parameters, along lines 2000 Clinton parameters? Or, less ambitiously, short (one two page) statement principles? c. What role U.S. play? Will George another U.S. official present meetings? Will Netanyahu accept that? Is argument allowing two sides deal one another without intermediary, least while, seek play U.S.? d. What U.S. event impasse breakdown? Should present bridging proposals and, so, when? e. How much work done, parallel simultaneously direct talks, U.S. Palestinians one hand U.S. Israel other? Beyond questions, I persuaded important factor likely remain Netanyahu prepared do. You witnessed first-hand difficult deal Palestinians Arab world generally; fragile Abbas's political position; indecisive be. Still, bottom, relatively clear sense positions core issues ever reach moment truth. That case Netanyahu either know prepared share who, now, neither felt urgency reach deal discomfort status quo. Rather, happen feels (1) leadership U.S. administration genuinely trusts; (2) convinced combination agreement U.S. assurances meets core needs terms Israeli security international recognition Jewish character; (3) feels that, U.S. help, sell people survive -- even thrive -- politically. Getting Bibi accept core compromises enough, course. Other basic elements strategy must involve reaching effectively Israeli public ensuring strong, vocal Arab support U.S.- sponsored deal without Abbas cannot say yes Israelis lack incentive so. But point prerequisite successful peace effort U.S. convince prime minister -- various forms overt persuasion implicit pressure -- make necessary compromises. At end day, Bibi make deal, deal U.S. much Palestinians. 2. At political level, past year clearly demonstrated degree U.S. hamstrung low ratings Israel among important segments domestic Jewish constituency. At level personalities, George, skill perseverance, cannot secure serious concessions parties himself. It different Dennis Clinton Administration. This mean Mitchell crucial role going forward. Indeed, empowered active involvement. The president faces different less difficult problem. Your Role Under circumstances, view, deeper involvement essential potentially highly beneficial. It selective involvement; Mitchell still must day-to-day negotiator others also must play part. But probably know zone possible agreement. Not Bibi and, I believe, ideally suited begin series in-depth conversations aimed understanding key concerns, met, would need us others, far, end day, prepared go Palestinians security needs met. Bibi knows trusts you; fact, almost certainly high-level U.S. official trusts most. PIR <preines Monday, August 16, 2010 11:48 PM Huma Abedin; CDM; Jake Sullivan "minister skirt" http://mobile.nytimes.com/a rticle?a=644869 North Korea Takes Twitter YouTube By CHOE SANG-HUN The New York Times August 17, 2010 SEOUL, South Korea - North Korea taken propaganda war South Korea United States new frontier: YouTube Twitter. In last month, North Korea posted series video clips YouTube brimming satire vitriol leaders South Korea United States. In one clip, called Secretary State Hillary Rodham Clinton "minister skirt" Secretary Defense Robert M. Gates "war maniac," depicting South Korean defense minister, Kim Tae-young, "servile dog" likes patted "its American master." Such language used standard North Korea's cold-war-era propaganda. Its revival testimony increased chill relations Koreas recent months. In past week, North Korea also began operating Twitter account name uriminzok, "our nation." Both Twitter YouTube accounts owned user named "uriminzokkiri." The Web site www.uriminzokkiri.com run Committee Peaceful Reunification Korea, propaganda agency Pyongyang. Lee Jong-joo, spokeswoman Unification Ministry Seoul, said, "It clear accounts carry propaganda North's official news media, able find operates them." The two Koreas agreed stop psychological war first summit meeting 2000. But South Korea resumed propaganda radio broadcasts May, accused North torpedoing one warships, killing 46 sailors. North Korea, denies involvement, vowed retaliate. It appears found way Twitter YouTube, intended audience clearly South Koreans. (North Korea keeps people isolated outside world.) "YouTube Twitter gave North Korea high-tech detour propaganda," said Paik Hak-soon, analyst Sjong Institute. "But fundamentally, it's new technology rather political tension drives North lash desperately face mounting international pressure." During cold war era, South Korea punished people caught listening North Korean broadcasts. Several years ago, brief era "sunshine policy" engaging North, South allowed people access North Korean Web sites. But today, computer user South Korea clicks item North Korean Twitter account, government warning "illegal content" pops up. These blocks triggered criticism Seoul government trust people form opinions totalitarian North. But government says North using Internet spread conspiracy theories behind sinking South Korean warship, including one claim American submarine foster militant mood South. The Twitter account, provides links North Korean Web site, 928 followers Monday. But YouTube video clips uploaded North commanded thousands views. In one clip, North Korea attacked Yu Myung-hwan, South Korean foreign minister, recently criticized "pro- North Korean youths" voted opposition June local elections, saying, "If like North much, go live Kim Jong-il." The clip's narrator calls Mr. Yu "pro-American flunky" advised Mr. Yu earn living "mopping floor Pentagon." Another clip claimed North Korea would prevail war "American imperialists" armed nuclear-fusion technology; juche, ideology "self-reliance"; philosophical treatise written Kim II-sung, North's founding president father Kim Jong-il, died 1994. "I don't think propaganda North significant impact among South Koreans," said Yoo Ho-yeol, expert North Korea Korea University here. "People watch fun, influenced."

Hurricane Tomas route Haiti hit 4 Nov right southern claw. SouthCom's announcement: USS IWO JIMA DEPLOYS TO HAITI AS TROPICAL STORM APPROACHES MIAMI - U.S. Southern Command directed amphibious ship USS Iwo Jima (LHD 7) steam toward Haiti today preparation forecasted arrival tropical storm Tomas later week. Iwo Jima deploy Haiti Suriname, arrived Thursday final country visit Continuing Promise 2010, four-month, humanitarian civic assistance deployment eight nations Caribbean region. The ship scheduled arrive Haiti later week. Large amphibious ships, like Iwo Jima, resemble small aircraft carriers include ability support helicopter landing craft operations quickly move personnel cargo, making ideal platform support humanitarian-relief missions short notice. A crew 1,600 military civilian medical, engineering, aviation, logistical support personnel embarked aboard Iwo Jima, including U.S. Navy engineers, contingent 500 Marines logistical-support expertise, volunteers U.S. Public Health Service various non-governmental organizations (NG0s), well medical, dental engineering professionals Europe, North America South America. Eight CH-46 Sea Knight, medium-lift, dual-rotor helicopters; two MH-60 Knight Hawk helicopters two amphibious landing craft units (ICU's) Iwo Jima support ship's operations. Iwo Jima Wasp-class amphibious ship capable speeds excess 20 knots provide robust ship-to-shore, well shore-to-shore logistics support contingencies ranging traditional military operations humanitarian disaster-relief missions. Because Caribbean region's history severe-weather events peak months hurricane season, ship remained area throughout present deployment, ready support U.S. disaster relief efforts directed. Iwo Jima Port-de-Paix, Haiti, July 24 Aug. 3. It first stop CP10 crew provided medical assistance 4,000 Haitian citizens, performed 32 surgeries, completed six engineering projects, delivered 231 pallets humanitarian-assistance supplies donated NG0s. In September 2008, amphibious ship USS Kearsarge deployed Haiti support U.S. relief efforts succession storms (Fay, Gustav, Hanna Ike) devastated country. Kearsarge provided robust air sealift support, delivering 3.3 million pounds food, water aid communities impacted disasters. ### Related links: About Continuing Promise 2010: http://www.southcom.mil/AppsSC/factFiles.php?id=155 Photo USS Iwo Jima: http://www.southcom.mil/AppsSC/images/uploads/634159131775283089.jpg CLASSIFICAT1ON:UNCLASSIFIED

FYI The Christian Science Monitor - CSMonitor.com War terror: Obama softened language, hardened Muslim hearts The Obama administration's shift counterterrorism language sought bridge divide Muslim world soften Americans' fear Islam. But new rhetoric hasn't matched policy, unintended costs home abroad high. By Stuart Gottlieb posted October 14, 2010 9:58 EDT New Haven, Conn. — One defining aspects Obama administration's counterterrorism strategy effort change America's rhetorical approach threat terrorism, particularly Islamic terrorism. "The language use matters," President Obama told Arabic satellite television station Al Arabiya interview first week office. Scrubbed George W. Bush-era terms like "war terrorism," "radical Islam," "jihadist."The White House's 2010 National Security Strategy formally replaced term "Islamic terrorism" "violent extremism." The purpose shift semantics two-fold. First, aimed repackage fight terrorism specific fight Al Qaeda, Islamic extremism, Mr. Obama believes contributed post-9/11 perception America "at war Islam." Indeed, new rhetoric gone hand hand Obama's outreach Muslim world build "a new partnership based mutual respect mutual interest." Second, part broader effort soften Americans' fear Islamic terrorism, Obama officials believe plays directly hands extremists. Language change ineffective Now fair ask whether Obama's use language regarding terrorism proven effective. Startling new polls suggest hasn't. The first, Brookings Institution Washington, shows May 2009 May 2010 number Middle Eastern Arabs expressing optimism Obama's approach toward region dropped 51 percent 16 percent, describing "discouraged" Obama presidency rising 15 percent 63 percent. The second, Pew Research Center, shows August 2010 fewer Americans held favorable view Islam (30 percent) five years earlier Bush administration (41 percent), Americans (35 percent) saying Islam encourages violence religions (in 2002, 25 percent). These starkly negative trend lines suggest limited utility language fighting terrorism. Yes, terrorism propaganda-fueled activity – ongoing battle win hearts minds attract new recruits fight cause. And course language used combating terrorism vital – counterproductive "smoke 'em out" rhetoric Bush administration case point. But rhetoric match policy, appears discount play threats, credibility – thus effectiveness – overall counterterrorism strategy may undermined. It appears Obama administration dug hole. Rhetoric doesn't match policy When looking beyond nuanced language appealing promises, Muslims around world see administration ramped war Afghanistan; killing scores Muslim civilians drone strikes; continues hold 1,000 Muslim detainees Guantanamo, Bagram, prisons; maintains seemingly unconditional support Israel. This critique policies, point match raised expectations Muslim world muddled Obama's oft-stated goal turning Muslims toward America away extremist movements. The price downplaying threat A large price also paid domestically disconnected rhetoric. Despite maintaining nearly Bush's hard-line tactics — USA Patriot Act, warrantless surveillance, indefinite detentions White House consistently played threat, even face clear uptick terrorism activity. For example, following failed 2009 Christmas Day airline bombing, Obama described suspect "isolated extremist," despite ties Al Qaeda. And administration's initial response failed May 2010 Times Square bombing American Muslim trained Pakistan call "one-off' event. Attorney General Eric Holder stated congressional testimony believed recent Islamic terror plots unconnected, unrelated radical Islam. There little doubt administration's unwillingness speak candidly Islamic terrorism taken toll public's trust. A Gallup poll released last month shows Americans favoring Republicans Democrats issue terrorism 55 percent 31 percent — 49 percent 42 percent last fall. Time reverse trend Obama entered office promising fight smarter effective war terrorism, many ways has. His instincts maintain aggressive tactics toning inflammatory rhetoric sound. Yet administration seems overlearned key lesson Bush years — overstating threat terrorism costs attached. So, too, rhetoric understates threat, especially detached policy. It late reverse troubling trend. The White House begin focusing less overly reassuring rhetoric — paid dividends home abroad — candid accounting threats faced policies employed confront them. Stuart Gottlieb, former foreign-policy adviser speechwriter US Senate (1999-2003), director policy studies Jackson Insti tute Global Affairs Yale. He's editor "Debating Terrorism Counterterrorism: Con filo ting Perspectives Causes, Contexts, Re sponses." The original version piece appeared online edition The National Interest. © The Christian Science Monitor. All Rights Reserved. Terms service provided you. Privacy Policy.

For Sunday reading, summary interesting proposal former Jordanian foreign minister Marwan Muasher. "Palestinian-Israeli Direct Talks: The Case Regional Approach"By Marwan Muasher (Carnegie Endowment Bulletin, August 2010) Marwan Muasher – former Jordanian foreign minister, ambassador, deputy prime minister – advocates regional settlement Israeli-Palestinian conflict, capitalizing 2002 Arab Peace Initiative. His approach depends first securing end-game "deposits" parties: The parties would offer hypothetical commitments might willing give onset, "deposited" U.S. committed side willing same. Saudi Arabia's deposit, instance, would outline agree package included details Jerusalem. The Saudi package would also promise secure Arab Muslim backing painful compromises Palestinians would need accept. Muasher advocates similar approach Syrian track—asking Syria deposit end-game commitments return full Israeli withdrawal Golan Heights. In deposits, Saudis Syrians must clearly commit address inclusion Hamas Hezbollah regional agreement. The Arab states would end logistical, financial, military support two groups, would assume responsibility delivering two actors, helping transform political players. Israel's deposit would spell commitment solution based 1967 borders return Golan. According Muasher, deposits would make much easier President Abbas engage talks aimed ending conflict. After given Arab cover, Abbas could provide end-game deposits. According Muasher, absent commitments Arab states, Palestinian positions remain maximalist. Once U.S. deposits sides make reasonable, comprehensive package, put package table cooperation Quartet. Once comprehensive package presented, U.S. focus confidence- building measures move sides toward end game. AM

Slaughter, Anne-Marie <SlaughterA@state.gov> Tuesday, November 23, 2010 11:52 PM Abedin, Huma; Sullivan, Jacob J; Mills, Cheryl D Chet Crocker, Scott Lasensky, Sam Lewis OPED MEP Crocker Lasensky Lewis OPED.doc I'm abusing privileges sending two emails one evening, published yet. November 2010 Declaring America's Stand Middle East Peace By Chester A. Crocker, Scott B. Lasensky Samuel W. Lewis Faltering Middle East peace talks need jolt. Washington powerful option moving process forward: taking firm stand end conflict. An American declaration principles—carefully crafted properly marketed--could spark debate thereby change political calculus leaders. As mediator world power, one America's strongest assets ability legitimize ideas rally others support. A central role U.S. conflict must define zone negotiability. This mean imposing peace. Rather, would statement basic principles U.S. believes guide parties toward negotiated solution. America long declared support "two states," must say means practice. Even current talks resume, without American ideas parties unlikely agree broad trade-offs necessary reach peace deal. A quick deal "borders security," many proposed, unlikely without Washington addressing end-game. Otherwise, sides would exposed issues set later discussion, like Jerusalem refugees. Opinion polling consistently showed support peace strongest core issues addressed. An American statement principles would mobilize regional support. It would provide, first time, public framework engaging sponsors Arab Peace Initiative. It would also strengthen ability reassert importance regional support structure bilateral negotiations, especially reviving multilateral contacts meetings involving Israelis neighbors throughout region. Moreover, greater regional engagement peace process carry powerful benefits regional challenges like Iranian nuclear program. A clearer U.S. declaration also surest way protect prospects two-state solution unrelenting onslaught ground pushes parties away peace deal. An American set ideas would anchor present-day demands issues like Jerusalem, security settlements clear vision future. Perhaps urgently, would broaden debate narrow confines settlements question. At minimum, American declaration based 1967 lines, agreed territorial swaps; support compromise Jerusalem allows two capitals two states; include provisions security limitations guarantees; reiterate America's support agreed solution refugee problem; reaffirm long-standing commitment State Israel. But American principles also include caveat, given ultimate interest agreed, viable solution—not particular formula. What would take American ideas succeed? Unlike past efforts, Washington try 'pre-cook' declaration one parties choreograph reactions. In fact, U.S. statement principles would explicitly described country believes support; implication cannot support. Thus, U.S. statement would designed achieve immediate approval adoption parties. Its purpose would clarify America stands, define interests work for. It would aim influencing climate thinking region, sobering illusions encouraging need support. Timing context course key considerations. Assuming current gridlock negotiations persists, time must elapse election results digested, abroad, public attention redirected toward foreboding increasingly dangerous Arab-Israel stalemate. A presidential speech essential dramatize seriousness purpose lay principles. It immediately followed major, high level diplomatic effort persuade key Middle East leaders Quartet UN allies genuine desire regionalize peacemaking effort. To maximize support key members Congress, speech occur Congress adjourns. No consultation stalemated parties beyond routine precede speech, leaks contents must kept absolute minimum purpose undermined. The speech could usefully also remove veil silence shrouds breakthroughs past negotiations; example, progress Annapolis process. As substance, endorsement two-state solution comprehensive Arab-Israeli peace, Obama Administration hinted Palestinian settlement also accompany normalized relations Israel Arab states, putting broader framing around traditionally defined conflict Israel immediate neighbors. The normalization piece puzzle fully articulated part new strategy based presenting American ideas parties. It way entice skeptical Israelis, also leads back long overdue need Washington engage Arab Peace Initiative. If U.S. puts forward peace principles, American leadership ensure diplomatic process defined clear picture possible parties expect gain negotiated settlement, never gain without one. Skeptics say risky present American ideas parties, would pull rug current leaders, exposing withering domestic criticism. Others argue galvanize obstructionists, support compromise, could well precipitate crisis ground. Others simply worry cost American prestige key players react negatively. But risks overstated, complete collapse process would far dangerous, particularly strategic environment shifts favor regional forces seek undermine, rather promote peace. America must limit managing conflict often upended shared interests peace stability. END Chester A. Crocker Professor Strategic Studies Georgetown University School Foreign Service; Scott Lasensky Senior Research Associate U.S. Institute Peace; Samuel W. Lewis retired diplomat former U.S. Ambassador Israel. These views own.

Let try again. Robert Pape top strategic thinker U Chicago best known empirical work showing strong correlation suicide terrorism occupation foreign troops. In new work proposing grand strategy off-shore/on-shore balancing. Below elevator version, least academic's version elevator version. What interesting closely tracks emphasis civilian power need smaller military due budget constraints. If want attached one-page proposal outlines 3-year series steps apply proposal Afghanistan. "An Alternative Security Strategy. Off-shore/on-shore balancing seeks achieve America's core national security objectives combination over-the-horizon ("off-shore") military power in-region ("on-shore") economic political power. Off-shore/on-shore balancing alternative advancing U.S. security goals deployment large ground forces overseas, already problematic likely become even economic challenges continue chronic resentment deepens. Off-shore/on-shore balancing relies naval, air, rapidly deployable ground forces combination on-site economic political support local partners secure America's interests combating terrorism achieving key national security goals, particularly Middle East Asia." FORMER PRESIDENT I NEW YORK SECRETARY OF STATE I WASHINGTON Speaking Council Foreign Relations September, Hillary Rodham Clinton sounded confident note: "After years war uncertainty, people wondering future holds, home abroad. So let say clearly: The United States can, must, lead new century." Ironically, two people crucial new global century Clintons themselves: ex-president ex-would-be-president, power couple defined position outside highest reaches power. Except that, days, Clintons influential, beloved, ever. Bill's Clinton Global Initiative starting feel like sexier, effective competitor Davos United Nations itself, bringing world leaders together commit resources fighting poverty market-based, technocratic solutions. As summer, foundation contributed $23 million countless man-hours effort rebuild Haiti. Polls shown he's better advocate Democratic candidates actual president, spent fall stumping woebegone Dems Orlando Seattle. Meanwhile, Hillary showed one recent poll popular political figure United States, accolade earned no-drama approach array thankless tasks: brushing Vladimir Putin's temper tantrum reach agreement nuclear disarmament Iran sanctions, promoting women's rights objections entrenched traditionalists, launching innovative effort bring clean cookstoves world's poorest. But mainly stood American competence, Quadrennial Diplomacy Development Review major, unglamorous step toward making U.S. statesmanship agile beast. If Clinton nostalgia looks like, bring on. 74. Michele Flournoy Anne-Marie Slaughter setting tone United States engages world. POLICY PLANNING CHIEFS, DEFENSE AND STATE DEPARTMENTS I WASHINGTON Barack Obama campaigned 2008 promise changing style substance United States deals allies enemies abroad, job figuring enact changes fell largely two people particular. At State Department, Anne-Marie Slaughter, director policy planning, spearheading department's Quadrennial Diplomacy Development Review. The review aims rejuvenate marginalized civilian agencies U.S. Agency International Development, preparing world America's worst threats great-power rivals upheavals associated failed failing states. Slaughter's Pentagon counterpart Undersecretary Policy Michele Flournoy, co-founder Center New American Security think tank, articulated vision new Democratic realism foreign policy candidates Hillary Clinton Obama embraced 2008 election. In 2010 oversaw Pentagon's quadrennial review, blueprint cuts back big-ticket weapons systems focuses instead immediate needs posed today's asymmetrical conflicts. Flournoy also vocal advocate Obama's Afghanistan strategy, albeit pragmatic one: "I don't want suggest achieving success simple easy," told Senate February. Verma, Richard R <VermaRR@state.gov> Friday, November 5, 2010 6:05 AM H; Lew, Jacob J; Mills, Cheryl D FW: The Cable: Granger seeking chairmanship State foreign ops subcommittee The Cable: Granger seeking chairmanship State foreign ops subcommittee Granger seeking chairmanship State foreign ops subcommittee Posted: 03 NOV 2010 1131 AM PDT Texas Congresswoman Kay Granger seek chairmanship State Foreign Operations Appropriations Subcommittee, according spokesman, ending rumors would forgo post favor position. Although decisions made, last night Granger ranking Republican panel clear frontrunner job. She would succeed current chairwoman Nita Lowey(D-NY), served chairwoman since 2006. "Congresswoman Granger interested continuing chair state foreign operations appropriations subcommittee," Matt LeffingwelL press secretary, toldThe Cable Wednesday. When power switches Congress, complicated game musical chairs begins senior members jockey committee subcommittee chairs. Just highest-ranking minority member panel doesn't mean one automatically takes chairmanship. But Granger succeed Lowey, play large role writing bills appropriate money State Department operations, USAID, foreign operations, foreign assistance, humanitarian assistance, many things. Those accounts face unprecedented pressure next year GOP led Congress looking spending cuts don't strong domestic constituencies. Last month, identified Granger one 10 Republicans stand influential next Congress GOP won control House. Since then, we've received several e-mails sources heard Granger would forgo subcommittee chairmanship pursue leadership another panel. We've heard Ander Crenshaw (R-FL), third-ranking Republican panel, eyeing chairmanship expectation Granger would step aside. (Mark Kirk (R-IL), second-ranking Republican subcommittee, elected Tuesday night become junior senator Illinois, seat held Barack Obama.) So would subcommittee chairwoman Granger handle responsibility writing State foreign ops appropriations bill? Here's reported October: Although [Granger] supported bill put forth year current chairwoman Nita Lowey CD-N.Y.), criticizedthe increases foreign-ops budget, saying, "We also face continued concern country economy devastating effects skyrocketing deficits debt." She's strong supporter balanced budget amendment, doesn't bode well foreign-aid funding dismal fiscal environment. Granger also serves defense subcommittee, placing intersection debate balance national security budget shift resources defense diplomacy development. Here seems favor Pentagon, saying June, "I want sure aren't increasing foreign aid expense troops." Her lack support international organizations criticized group Citizens Global Solutions, gave "F" 2007to 2009 rating. Granger also board efforts eliminate aid countries performing internal reform, explained expressing opposition funding Senegalese government State Department's Millennium Challenge Corporation. "We can't give money say put whatever doing," said. The committee leadership assignments won't doled least two three weeks, Hill sources report. But Granger's bid successful, she'll instantly influential. The fiscal 2011 State Foreign Ops bill still completed Congress, despite fiscal year began Oct. 1. The stop gap funding measure funding programs since then, known "continuing resolution," expires December. The lame duck Democratic led Congress unlikely able pass full appropriations bills way door, likely pass another short term continuing resolution. That would leave final work actual bill incoming class led GOP next year. You subscribed email updates The Cable Email delivery powered Google To stop receiving emails, may unsubscribe now. Our collective task realize principle integrating gender policies programs State Department USAID enduring way. We concerned current draft QDDR falls short call. In existing draft, Office Global Women's Issues falls new Under Secretary Civilian Security, Democracy Human Rights retaining Ambassador-at-Large Global Women's Issues reports directly Secretary. This new structure misses simple important reality women half world's population major security, economic social challenges century cannot solved without them. These issues cut across work department touch virtually regions, though place special emphasis regions women girls vulnerable, countries experiencing conflict transition. Locating office within one bureau makes impossible Office implement charge — integrate gender effectively work entire State Department. Therefore, gender must integrated throughout regional functional bureaus rather located within one bureau. Women integral diplomatic efforts—from traditional bilateral multilateral relationships, strategic dialogues, public diplomacy, relations civil society, community leaders non-state actors. Women also important consider policy initiatives, including global health, food security, climate change, economic issues, human rights, peace security. We must institute rigorous institutional mechanisms ensure bureaus, regional functional, consider gender diplomacy development. In order integrate gender effectively throughout work Department, recommend following approach planning, budgeting, structure evaluation: Maintain visibility focus gender. Retain Ambassador-at-Large Global Women's Issues reports Secretary. This position embodies commitment advocacy gender equality essential part diplomacy development signals understanding important national security United States. In addition, office advances coherent coordinated strategy gender throughout State Department USAID. [DONE] Ensure gender effectively addressed throughout bureaus missions. We recommend following structural changes State. First, make Principal Deputy Assistant Secretary (PDAS) regional functional bureaus responsible accountable bureaus' work gender. The Office Global Women's Issues would serve resource PDAS issues. Second, assign specialized gender liaisons regional bureaus purposes integration, needed. Third, include training capacity development employees gender Issues (in Foreign Civil Service well political appointees). Fourth, evaluate PDAS bureau gender integration policies programs (including, example, component Performance Evaluation System). Similarly, require Chief Mission responsible accountable mission's work gender, assign personnel expertise manage work gender, require personnel receive training gender issues, evaluated work. A parallel structure put place USAID, diplomacy development work gender coordinated complimentary. [THIS IS RECOMMENDATION, WITH SOME VARIATION, MADE FOR MANY AREAS — PUBLIC DIPLOMACY, MULTILATERAL AFFAIRS, AND OTHERS — CHALLENGE WILL BE TO IDENTIFY HOW TO ADDRESS EFFECTIVELY AND CREAT A PDAS JOB THAT IS MEANINGFUL GIVEN THE NEW RESPONSIBILITIES SOUGHT TO BE IMPOSED THROUGH THAT POSITION] Include gender strategic planning budget allocation. Each bureau required describe policies programs improve gender equality strengthen work generally. They also required, extent possible, outline portion policies programs target affect women girls. They asked write following; cleared L. It quite profound. By EMILY PARKER In 2007 I flew Lima interview Mario Vargas Llosa newspaper. We talked elegant home, surrounded thousands books. Mr. Vargas Llosa offered glass red wine. Then proceeded discuss believes literature change world. Mr. Vargas Llosa's Nobel Prize great victory—and talented prolific author. His work perhaps greatest rebuttal believe literature exists periphery history politics, claim "no time" fiction. In New Republic essay 2001, Mr. Vargas Llosa argued granting literature "an important place life nations." He wrote, 'Without it, critical mind, real engine historical change best protector liberty, would suffer irreparable loss." Mr. Vargas Llosa's novels reflect deep, personal hatred dictatorships staunch belief value individual liberty. He hardly novelist shed light themes, I would argue among successful. Columnist Mary Anastasia O'Grady anti-Communist Peruvian writer. A case point "Conversation Cathedral," work Mr. Vargas Llosa said would rescue first fire. The novel set Peru, dark days Manuel Odria dictatorship 1950s, Mr. Vargas Llosa grew up. He told book wanted describe dictatorships impregnate "every act life." To demonstrate this, Mr. Vargas Llosa paints around Odria rather confronting outright. The book opens grim landscape "uneven faded buildings" describes "dull defeated eyes tables Zela bar, hands reach ashtrays glasses beer." The narrative, rapidly jumps past present, describes stalled, confused world. You don't know trust. Mr. Vargas Llosa attacks politics openly "The Feast Goat," explicitly details horrors Trujillo regime Dominican Republic. Rafael Trujillo notorious victimization women, see life rule eyes one young girl unlucky enough crossed path. "The woman almost always first victim dictatorship," Mr. Vargas Llosa told me. For some, Mr. Vargas Llosa's victory controversial political background outspoken views. He unsuccessfully ran president Peru 1990, losing Alberto Fujimori. During campaign Mr. Vargas Llosa gained notoriety emphasis market economy, free trade private property. He less controversial support invasion Iraq, saw necessary ending called "monstrous dictatorship" Saddam Hussein. Mr. Vargas Llosa left politics, believes better shape world pen. Or told Lima: 'Through writing, one change history." Not work dark. "Aunt Julia Scriptwriter" punctuated humor, 'The Bad Girl," one man's world-wide pursuit elusive lover, thoroughly entertaining read. The one constant perceptive empathetic glimpse wide range human experience. As Mr. Vargas Llosa wrote 2001 essay literature, "Nothing better protects human stupidity prejudice, racism, religious political sectarianism, exclusivist nationalism truth invariably appears great literature: men women nations places essentially equal."
